name: Kasserine: The Battle of Kasserine Pass
description:
The Battle of Kasserine pass is an expansion module to the original GMT game Kasserine: Rommel's Battle for Tunisia, 1943 by Vance von Borries. It was released in issue Nr15 of RBM's C3i Magazine and features a new map of the Kasserine Pass and 40 new counters (15 German, 5 Italian, 18 American and 2 British). All units are company size.

The scale of the battle for Kasserine Pass differs from the original 2 miles/hex. The map is zoomed in on the pass itself and is scaled at 0.35 miles/hex. This also led to a change in time scale. Every turn is now 4 hours (instead of half a day in the original game).

A few minor alterations in the original rules have been made to accommodate the change of scale.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – A Roll of the Dice
description: The Great Houses each take long gambles in A Roll of the Dice, with all of the Seven Kingdoms at stake. As they double down on the strategies they hope will win them the Iron Throne, the Great Houses introduce new players to the game of thrones and explore new locations. They reinforce their positions by recruiting Armies, hiring Mercenaries, and treating with their Allies. Nonetheless, at the heart of every gamble is an element of chance, and fate plays a large role in this climactic conclusion to the intrigues and struggles Beyond the Narrow Sea. The Chapter Pack introduces eight new events that can drive thrilling plot twists into your games.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Giochi Uniti, Stratelibri

name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Desperate Circumstances
description:
Description from the publisher:

"I used to believe that being a good soldier meant doing everything they told you. That's how they engineered us. But we're not droids. We're not programmed. You have to learn to make your own decisions."
–Captain Rex

Desperate Circumstances is the third Force Pack in the Alliances cycle for Star Wars: The Card Game.

As the Galactic Civil War rages, its battles continue to spread from system to system and planet to planet. TIE engines roar through the skies. Blaster fire echoes off the hillsides. And galactic citizens everywhere are drawn into the fight—on one side or the other.

With its sixty new cards (two copies each of five different objective sets), Desperate Circumstances reaches far from Rebel and Imperial headquarters to follow the new alliances formed on both sides of the Galactic Civil War. You'll find the dark side reinforced by mysterious witches and a new version of the galaxy’s deadliest assassin droid while the light side’s defenders gain valuable strength from daring scouts, a Force-sensitive Lamproid, and one very special relic of the Old Republic.

Contains objective sets 270-274.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Dark Future: White Line Fever
description: This is a volume of advanced rules for Dark Future. Inside this book players will find new rules for maneuvers, shooting, hazards, and new equipment. Also, new vehicles are presented (trikes), new scenarios, and new characters as well.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Cthulhu Wars: Brown Jenkin
description:
The Brown Jenkin terror expansion contains a new type of Neutral Terror. Created by the winner of 'The Thousand Forms' contest, Collin "Xollnic" Townsend, made into an actual miniature expansion!

Brown Jenkin's ability:

Loathsome Titter (Gather Power Phase): If Brown Jenkin is in an Area with an enemy Controlled Gate during the Gather Power Phase gain power from that Gate and all Cultists in the Area regardless of faction. (Your own Cultists do not provide extra power if in the Area).

Familiar (Post-Battle and Doom Phase): If Brown Jenkin is Killed or Eliminated in Battle immediately pay 2 Power and place Brown Jenkin at your Controlled Gate. (This is not optional). If you cannot pay, pay 2 Power at the beginning of the Doom Phase and place Brown Jenkin at your Controlled Gate. (This is not optional).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Midville: a Car Wars adventure pack
description:
Welcome to Midville, now go home.

Midville, Ohio used to be a nice, sleepy little Middle-American town. But that was before the cycle gangs came...and left just as quickly with their tails between their legs! Now it's one of the most famous towns in America, thanks to UBN's hit show, Crash City. And all the Crash City fans are showing up to see if Midville is really "The Toughest Little Town in America."

Midville is a city with a rep to protect -- if you're a visitor you'll get the right hand of friendship extended in a neighborly fashion. But if you're a biker, or anyone else bent on causing trouble, you better watch out. The MONDOs are the toughest neighborhood watch team this side of the Texas Rangers!

But if you're looking for action, Midville is the place. If it isn't an over-exuberant Crash City fan shooting up downtown, it's a full-scale battle between MONDOs and whoever happens to be closest!

Midville gives you a look at a not-so-typical small town of the 2040's. Inside you'll find:


A 24 page rulebook with background, descriptions and scenarios.



Four 21" x 32" maps, which can be used on their own or with maps from Car Wars Deluxe Edition or Boat Wars.



An 8" x 10" full-color counter sheet containing everything from dueling teams to city vehicles.


Part of the Car Wars Series.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Racing
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Catan Scenario: Crop Trust
description:
In Catan Scenario: Crop Trust, players balance their individual need to harvest crops against their collective goal to store and preserve seeds in the Seed Vault. Players who harvest too much endanger the seed diversity, and in doing so, threaten Catan with mass extinctions and a collapse of the food supply.

This scenario was developed in collaboration with the Global Crop Diversity Trust, an independent international organization whose goal is to preserve crop diversity in order to protect global food security.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Arcadia Quest: Steady Slingshot Promo Pack
description: This is a promotional set of cards given away at Cool Mini Or Not's 2016 CMON Expo. These four cards are each a slingshot weapon that is stronger if you don't use your movement.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Legends Untold: Treasure Novice Booster
description:
Foes! Loot! Strange wells! No Adventure is complete without finding Loot guarded by the strange and unusual inhabitants of the Great Sewers and Weeping Caves. Plumb the depths of the Sewers and Caves to find the Great Diversion to see where your Adventure may continue.

The Treasure Pack gives more Foes and Loot to switch into any adventure in Legends Untold. The Great Diversion is a unique Location that links together the Caves and Sewers and allows you to continue onto the Ancient Crypts and Brethren Works.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

The dice and tokens feature thematic designs and are to replace the standard dice and wooden tokens that are included in the base game.

The dice and tokens feature thematic designs and are to replace the standard dice and wooden tokens that are included in the base game.

name: Ave Roma: CONSUL expansion
description: The Consul expansion adds a new card action location to the game. There is a new type of card to be purchased and a new resource, gold is introduced.

name: Dinner in Paris: Battle of the Chefs
description:
On the Parisian square, competition among the restaurants still runs high and the animosity has escalated: theft of ingredients, noise pollution, terrace defacing… In this square in constant turmoil, you can count on your food truck to expand your influence and surprise your opponents.

FROM NOW ON, EVERYTHING IS PERMITTED IN ORDER TO BECOME THE BEST RESTAURANT OWNER IN PARIS
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Race

name: Escape Room: Das Spiel 2
description:
Escape Room The Game is the game where you need to work together to solve puzzles and to find hidden clues. It’s always a race against the clock; you only have 60 minutes to escape. The Chrono Decoder counts down, creates the right atmosphere and tells you when you can use hints. In this game you either win together or you lose together. All players have to get the best out of themselves. To solve riddles and puzzles in time, teamwork is the key to success. Unbelievable how quickly 60 minutes pass in the heat of the moment.

4 NEW ADVENTURES, CAN YOU ESCAPE IN TIME?
Are you already familiar with Escape Room the Game? Feel the tension of an Escape Room in your own living room again with the four new adventures of Escape Room The Game 2.

Have you not played Escape Room the Game yet? Then you can expect a challenging and unpredictable game!

The German edition contains the following adventures: Alice in Wonderland, Another Dimension, Wild West Express and The Break-In. The last 2 adventures are new ones and not included in the Dutch, Korean, and Spanish version which is found here: Escape Room: The Game 2.
.............................................................

The Break-In

Heute Nacht ist es endlich soweit! Lange habt ihr euch auf euren Einbruch in das Lockholm Museum vorbereitet. Das Ziel? Ein unbezahlbares Kunstwerk der berühmten Künstlerin Esa Cape. Stehlt die Skulptur, versteckt euch vor den Wachen und entkommt ungesehen wieder aus dem Museum, bevor ihr erwischt werdet!

Alice in Wonderland

„Ich komme zu spat!”, ruft ein weißer Hase, während er auf eine Uhr sieht. „Die Teeparty beginnt bald!“

Ein sprechender Hase? Ihr seht nicht richtig! Er hoppelt in ein kleines Loch, und ihr folgt ihm hinterher. Als ihr in einem Raum mit einem riesigen Tisch landet, wird euch klar: hier irgendwo ist der Zugang ins Wunderland! Entkommt in einer Stunde, oder bleibt für immer hier!

Wild West Express

Während einer gemütlichen Zugfahrt nach Escapetown wird der Zug von Banditen überfallen. Sie haben die Lok übernommen und wollen den Zug in einer Stunde in einen Abgrund steuern. Das würde ein böses Ende nehmen…

Überwältigt die Banditen, übernehmt die Kontrolle über die Lokomotive und stoppt den Zug, bevor er den Abgrund erreicht!

Another Dimension

Seit mehreren Monaten passieren komische Dinge in Lockholm. Ihr seid in die nahe Militärbasis eingebrochen um den mysteriösen Ereignissen auf die Spur zu kommen. Doch was ihr dort vorfindet, könnt ihr kaum glauben… hier gibt es ein Portal in eine andere Dimension! Wer wagt sich zu einer besonderen Begegnung?
categories: Electronic, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: Warhammer 40,000: Heroes of Black Reach – Vanguard Squad / Ork Freebooterz
description:
2 punch boards packaged together. They are not available individually.

Ork Freebooterz are notorious pirates and thieves, plying the void in smoking, sparking ships with the intent of causing as much mayhem and destruction as possible. They prey upon anyone foolish enough to stray into their hunting grounds, screaming out of the dark on plumes of fire to blast apart their foes. When an enemy vessel is crippled or foolishly tries to surrender, the Freebooterz will smash their way on board, killing anything that moves and stealing anything that doesn’t. The Freebooterz will then haul their booty back to their hidden bases and count their ill-gotten gains.

Freebooterz content:

Kaptin Doomskorcha
Flash Gitz with their options
Freebooterz Runtherd and Gretchins with their options
1 Freebooterz Battlewagon
Wargear and Upgrade Options
Rule sheets in French and English


A Vanguard Veteran Squad is formcd from those Space Marines of the Chapter’s 1st Company who have completely immersed themselves in the art of close-quarters combat. Most of them have served lengthy rotations in the Chapter’s Assault Squads prior to their promotion, and their skills with chainblade and combat knife have been honed and tested in the crucible of bloody melee on a thousand war-torn world.

Content (1 punchboard):

1 Vanguard Veteran squad (with or without jump packs) with its Rhino
1 big defensive position
Wargear and Upgrade Options
Rule sheets in French and English


Only available on the Devil Pig Game web store.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue

Expand your Federation & Empire campaigns with new ships, rules, and systems: Statis Field Generators, Electronic Warfare, Light Tactical Transports, Marines, and the list goes on.

name: La Cosa Nostra: Poker Session
description:
Promo card for La Cosa Nostra named "Pokerrunde" ("Poker session").
The card says: "Jeder deiner Mitspieler legt $ 4.000 in die Mitte. Dann legst du genau so viel Geld dazu, wie schon im Pott liegt. Mit einer 4: du bekommst den Pott. Andernfalls: jeder deiner Mitspieler erhält seinen Einsatz verdoppelt aus dem Pott." (Every other player must put $4,000 in the middle of the table. You then have to add the same amount to double the pot. With a 4 you get the pot. Else: each other player gets his stake doubled from the pot."

mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Bolt Action: Armies of the Soviet Union
description: This supplement of Bolt Action provides players with all the information they need to field the military forces of the Soviet Union. From the Winter War against Finland to the bitter urban warfare of Stalingrad and the final drive to Berlin, the detailed army lists provided in this supplement allow players to construct Soviet armies for any theatre and any year of World War II.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Kingsport Dreams Asylum Pack
description:
Game description of the 2011 revised edition from the publisher:

Once again emerging from the deepest shadows comes Kingsport Dreams, another classic Asylum Pack in the Forgotten Lore cycle of expansions for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game! Kingsport Dreams reintroduces this intriguing Asylum Pack, updated to the 60-card per pack format (three copies each of 20 unique cards). In addition, the text on a number of cards has been altered from its original printing to better adjust for game balance and rules clarity, making for an exciting and challenging gaming experience for both new players and veterans alike.

Take a tour through Kingsport's most interesting locales and meet its charming - sometimes literally so - denizens. Each of Call of Cthulhu's factions will find someplace to call home in Kingsport. Also featured in Kingsport Dreams are a curious cast of characters, including Sorcerors Thomas Olney and Mentor to Vaughn (designed by 2006 Call of Cthulhu World Champion Chris Long), as well as two new Ancient Ones, Nodens and Tulzscha, and doomed necromancer Charles Dexter Ward.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Tinners' Trail: The Emigration Expansion
description: In The Emigration Expansion, you can send your workers overseas to gain ongoing benefits, such as extra income or free improvements.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Action Points, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Venice Connection: Mint Tide
description:
Venice Connection: Mint Tide introduces "T" canals in Venice!

While playing Venice Connection, you start with these four "T" canal tiles separate from the sixteen original tiles. These twenty tiles form the reserve; two of the "T" tiles have an I-shaped canal on the reverse side, while the other two feature an L-shaped canal.

The rules for tile placement remain the same as in the original game. On a turn, a player takes 1-3 tiles from the reserve, places them in a straight line with canals intersecting only canals and buildings adjacent only to other buildings, then places this line of tiles adjacent to at least one tile already in play (again, with canals not intersecting buildings. A player can use a "T" tile to add a branch to the canal, or they can use the reverse side for the "I" or "L" shape.

The rules for victory remain the same. If you make a tile placement that "closes the loop" — that is, so that every canal is connected to another canal — you win the game. If you think that the opponent's previous move makes it impossible to close the loop, you can say "Impossible!" If it is indeed impossible to close the loop, you win the game; if the opponent demonstrates how they can close the loop with the tiles that remain in the reserve, then they win.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Embarcadero: Unsinkable Expansion
description:
The Unsinkable expansion for Embarcadero introduces three all-new gameplay modules and has everything you need to add a fifth player. The individual modules can be mixed and matched in any combination.

Unsinkable Ships module: This module adds unsinkable ships to the game. These new ships provide special benefits when docked. But your benefits come at a cost because those ships cannot be sunk.

Entrepreneur Buildings module: The module adds entrepreneur buildings to the game. These new buildings each count as two different card types! They also provide all-new building bonuses.

Events module: This module adds events to the game. These events, which occur twice per game, change the game in various ways, with unique bonuses or decisions for the players to make.

-description from publisher
categories: American West, City Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Events

name: Peloponnes: Antioche
description:
Peloponnes: Antioche is a civilization tile (number 11) that was given as a free goodie in Plato Worldwide # 3.

It gives you 9 money and 3 population as a start. It's special function is that it protects you against ALL disasters, but as an income you'll lose 1 population.

This tile was later included as part of Peloponnes: Sacrum Expansion.
categories: Ancient, City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Zooloretto: Exotic – Chameleon
description:
Zooloretto: The Chameleon – first released as part of Zooloretto News No. 3 in 2010, then later available as a promotional item at Spiel 2012 – is a mini-expansion for Zooloretto Exotic, which is itself an expansion for Zooloretto.

Zooloretto: The Chameleon consists of two chameleon tiles, which are mixed into the stack of animal tiles. The chameleons are jungle animals, and when taken on a trolley back to a player's zoo must be placed on an empty space in the jungle board – adhering to the individual limit of having no more than three types of jungle animals on the jungle board – or placed in that player's barn. When a player adds the chameleon to his zoo, not only does he advance a visitor of the color of his choice, but he can also swap a visitor to his zoo with a visitor from the stock of any other color.

Like all other animals on the jungle board, the chameleon is worth zero points.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: AeroTech 2
description:
From the back cover:

"In the thirty-first century, the BattleMech reigns as king of the battlefield. But this title is not undisputed. Thundering down from deep space fly squadrons of deadly aerospace fighters, bristling with weapons rivaling the heaviest 'Mechs and loaded with deadly bombs. Their mission: to defend the space-faring DropShips and JumpShips, the lifeblood of every successful military operation.

Add the exciting dimension of aerospace combat to your BattleTech games with AeroTech 2. A companion to the BattleTech Master Rules, Revised, this book contains all the rules and background material you need to add aerospace fighters, WarShips and other spacecraft to your BattleTech and RPG games. These rules also support stand-alone air- or space-combat scenarios.

This Revised Edition of the rulebook has been extensively expanded and incorporates more than four years of player feedback to create the most comprehensive set of aerospace rules yet published for the BattleTech universe."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Heritage: The Gentleman's Story
description:
Designed by a true connoisseur of Vampire: The Masquerade, this mostly mission-based add-on follows the story of one Roger de Camden from the early 1300s to the mid-twentieth century.

The Gentleman's Story

This expansion adds a suite of infamous kindred to your copy of Vampire: The Masquerade - Heritage. Roger de Camden, otherwise known as "The Gentleman", provides letters of introduction to mysterious figures shaping the World of Darkness. Call upon their favor to alter your chronicle, twisting bloodlines and banishing troublesome characters to the shadows... or bringing them back.

This expansion features 28 cards to be added to the chronicle deck after the first chapter and revealed through play. Use the card ID (bottom right corner) to place them in the right order. The Gentleman's Story expansion introduces 2 new card types to the game.

Includes:
1 - Rule Card
4 - Strays
24 - Letters of Introduction

THE STRAYS
These 4 new and exclusive characters are implemented the same way as chronicle characters. The Victor of that chapter sleeves the new character with either side visible, and retains or adds them to the character deck. Strays include: Mahtiel, Abdalkutba, Pentweret, & Roger De Camden.

LETTERS OF INTRODUCTION
These 24 cards each conclude a specific mission chain. The player who has claimed the most corresponding missions receives the letter of introduction, which may be discard during any aftermath phase for the indicated effect. In the case of ties, no player receives the letter of introduction.

Retain - Instead of selecting a retainer from your bloodline, select any vampire of the indicated clan (including from an opponent's bloodline or the character deck).
Banish - Select any vampire of the indicated clan, and place them into this expansion box. They may not be used for the rest of the chronicle.
Readmit - Return any previously banished vampire into play, moving them from this expansion box to the character deck.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Legacy Game, Once-Per-Game Abilities

name: Once Upon a Time: Fairy Tales
description:
Description from the publisher:

Pixies, goblins, and leprechauns live under toadstools and behind waterfalls in fairy tales, making mischief, delighting children, and spreading dewdrops across spiderwebs.

Fairy Tales is an expansion for Once Upon a Time, the card game in which players tell a story together using cards that show fairy tale elements and endings. Shuffle these elfin cards into your Once Upon a Time collection to sprinkle some magic fairy dust on your storytelling fun!

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Called by the Conclave
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Called by the Conclave is the third Chapter Pack in the Secrets of Oldtown expansion cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. Featuring 60 never-before-seen cards cards – three copies each of 20 unique cards – designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the A Game of Thrones metagame, this exciting expansion strengthens the Maesters further, as well as the Houses that the Conclave compels them to serve.

Introducing new characters to the LCG environment like Maester Murenmure and Galbart Glover, as well as a powerful new version of Magister Illyrio, Called by the Conclave will add new dimensions to your A Game of Thrones experience. This Chapter Pack also features new additions to the developing Chain theme of attachments, including Lead Link and Tin Link - more tools to make your Maesters stronger and craftier than ever.

Called by the Conclave adds more variety to each House's arsenal, including support for House Targaryen's Dragons, House Martell's Sandsnakes, and a new Warship for House Greyjoy.

No matter what world they hail from, every Rebel trooper dedicates their life to fighting on the front lines for the cause of the Rebellion. Now, you can add even more diversity to your Rebel ranks with the new miniatures and upgrades found in the Rebel Troopers Upgrade Expansion.

This expansion for Star Wars: Legion contains four unpainted, finely sculpted soft plastic Rebel Trooper miniatures to enhance your existing Rebel Trooper units or to form one corps unit, along with new heavy weapon and personnel upgrade options.

name: Final Girl: Starter Set
description:
Playing on a famous horror movie trope, Final Girl is a solitaire-only game that puts the player in the shoes of a female protagonist who must kill the slasher if she wants to survive.

The Core Box, when combined with one of our Feature Film Boxes, has everything you need to play the game. Each Feature Film Box features a unique Killer and and iconic Location, and the more Feature Films you have, the more killer/location combinations you can experience!

In game terms, Final Girl shares similarities with Hostage Negotiator, but with some key differences that change it up, including a game board to track locations and character movement. You can choose from multiple characters when picking someone to play and multiple killers when picking someone to play against. Killers and locations each have their own specific terror cards that will be shuffled together to create a unique experience with various combinations of scenarios for you to play!

This starter pack contains the basic box and the feature film "The Happy Trails Horror", which will allow you to start playing immediately!

“There ain’t no AYE in team, but there is MEAT. And that’s you when we’re done.”

-Coach Dru

The Goblins approach Kaosball with the same attitude they approach life: We'll do things our own way. Worstshire's reputation as a rough and rowdy town with little to recommend it is well deserved. The Goblins are Kaosball’s anarchs, the team who spit on authority and defy convention. name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Queenie 15: New Quest Chambers
description:
This expansion adds three new Quest chambers: Riddle, Ascension and Guardian chambers



The Riddle chamber (Quest)Players must solve the riddle of the four statues! When this chamber is revealed, the four statues are placed face down in the four spaces in the chamber. When players roll a set of symbols, they reveal the tile. Tiles must be revealed in the order indicated on the wall (blue, red, yellow, green). If a tile is revealed out of order, all statues are turned back over and players must start again.



The Ascension chamber (Quest)In order to complete this task, players have to climb the steps in the chamber all the way to the top.

Players must climb from the bottom of the stairs to the top in sequence. When one player at the base of the steps or on a step rolls the required symbols for the next step, all players at the same level as that player in the chamber may move up to that step. This continues until the players reach the top of the steps, completing the Quest.



The Guardian chamber (Quest)You are not the only ones interested in the gems of the temple - the magical guardians are as well.

When you enter the Guardian Quest chamber, one guardian token per player must be placed in the center of the room. Players may pick up one of these guardians by rolling two Green symbols, picking up the token, and placing a die on top of it.

The player must then move to a chamber where a gem can be activated (regardless of whether the gem has already been activated or not), at which point the guardian is discarded and your die recovered. When all of the tokens have been delivered, the quest is complete.

name: River Wild: Wildscapes
description:
The land of Wild is full of surprises–new shores to explore, new relics to unearth, and new wonders to discover. With the Wildscapes expansion, you will unlock a new card each time you create a protected valley. How far will your river flow?

This 6-card expansion adds new locations which can drastically reshape your landscape. These cards are not shuffled into the deck; instead, whenever a valley is created, one of the expansion cards is added to the selection row, acting as a normal card for the purposes of selection and placement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Gathering of the Four Buried Secrets: A Solo Adventure for a Cleric in Four Against Darkness
description:
A Chaos sorceress is on the loose.
Dark clouds gather over the countryside.
Undead monsters are everywhere.
And there's a buried treasure that must not fall into the wrong hands.

Buried Secrets is a Four Against Darkness adventure for a single third level cleric. It is part of the Gathering of the Four campaign -- a series of five scenarios, four to be played as stand-alone adventures with a single hero, and the last to be played with the four heroes united against a common enemy.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Revolver: By the Gun They Died
description:
Revolver: By the Gun They Died, is a promotional set of cards available at Spiel 2012, that can be used to customise the two different decks in Revolver. Between matches, the owner of a deck can draft new cards in for old, leaving each deck at 62 cards. The cards included in the set are:

Colonel McReady's deck:


Apache Warrior (5 copies)
"Set the train ablaze!"
Pony Express Relay Station
Ruined Chapel at El Ray
Herschel Papazian - Pinkerton Sharpshooter
Sefton Redshaw - Bounty Hunter
Clear Skies
Brady Logan
Elias Hooker
"Wriggler" Hooley and the Swain Boys


Jack Colty's deck:


Austin Granby - Railroad Engineer
"She's carryin' your grandchild!"
Banditos (5 copies)
Turkey Joe
Bullet: Vicious Mutt (alternate bandit)
Uncouple the Caboose
Buttermilk – Colty's Mustang
Robber's Roost (2 copies)
categories: American West, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Doomlings: Mythlings
description:
These mythical monsters are sure to strike the fancy of any fans of fantasy! (Say that ten times fast!)

While this 19-card expansion pack is included in the Blackbox and Gold Bundles, Doomlings is an additive game. This means there's no limit to the number of Mythlings you can add to your trait deck!

Mythlings exhibit traits of magic (red) and mischief (green) that defy the natural order of things!
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Pictomania: Geek Edition
description: Pictomania: Geek Edition is an 18-card expansion for Pictomania for all the board-, roleplaying- and videogamegeeks out there. It not only contains some cards from the original game from Czech Games Edition, like the titles from Harry Potter or Star Wars movies, but also several new categories like classic RPG races/classes, dice forms, famous sci-fi characters, and so on. Many of these categories were gathered by gamers themselves and compiled onto these 18 new double-sided cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Line Drawing

name: The Colonists: Ante Portas
description:
Die Kolonisten: Ante Portas, a new scenario for Tim Puls' epic strategy game The Colonists, introduces new combat mechanisms that allow players to compete against the game, or directly against each other.

Die Kolonisten: Ante Portas adds two areas in addition to your own colony and the "home country": the battlefield and the command center. On the battlefield, the actual battle takes place, while the command center forms a new area, which is constructed from hexes like the coreland. You enter this area in the usual way by jumping onto its market. Here are the actions necessary to win your battles. You can build structures, construct traps, mines and bombs, as well as hiring your farmers and citizens and train them to be soldiers. Also, it is possible to heal your soldiers after battle.

Die Kolonisten: Ante Portas offers the opportunity for one to three players to go up against the game or for two or four players to fight in "1 against 1" or "2 against 2" mode. The new mechanisms also offer a much higher player interaction, as desired by many players.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: New Tactical Games with Dice and Cards
description: In what appears to be Knizia's very first published work in the games arena, New Tactical Games with Dice and Cards is actually a book of rules which, for the most part, can be played with typical coins, dice, and playing cards.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Book, Card Game, Dice, Negotiation, Political, Sports
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Stock Holding

name: Trial by Trolley: R-Rated Track Expansion
description:
In Trial by Trolley, one player acts as the Trolley Operator and must choose where to send a murderous, out of control, trolley. Every other player at the table plays cards and argues in order to convince the operator to spare their lives and condemn everyone on the other track to a gruesome death-by-trolley.

This dirty expansion for Trial by Trolley adds 100 extremely R-Rated tracks for you to hit with a trolley. There’s a lot of really bad stuff in here. You’ve been warned!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting
publishers: Broadway Toys LTD, Hobby World, Magellan, Rebel Sp. z o.o., Skybound Tabletop

name: Cards Against Humanity: PAX East 2013 Promo Packs
description: Cards Against Humanity PAX East 2013 Promo Packs A, B, and C were released as promotional expansions for Cards Against Humanity at the Penny Arcade Expo East 2013 convention. Each pack contains 8 white cards and 2 black cards. The themes of these packs center around video games, sci-fi, tabletop board games, and the convention itself.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Munchkin Duck of Doom
description:
Munchkin Duck of Doom is a plush duck in the style of the "Duck of Doom" card from Munchkin. The duck has a zippered pouch on the bottom that comes loaded with two new Munchkin cards: "Curse! Peeking Duck" and "Re-Duck-ulous", a +5 monster enhancer.

Part of the Munchkin series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Kaosball: Team – Malltown Zombies
description:
No one denies that Kaosball is a deadly game. Teams are expensive to build, train and maintain. The Malltown Zombies have a rather ... unique solution to the problem. As long as they're well paid in brains, everything should be ok?

This is a Kickstarter and convention exclusive team!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports, Zombies
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Blue Moon: Water Spirit
description:
Promo 901 for Blue Moon.

A Leadership card that allows you to discard up to three cards and then draw up to the same number.

It is not affiliated with a people and costs one moon.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: A Touch of Evil: Special Edition Game Soundtrack
description:
Game description from Flying Frog's website:

"New Special Edition Game Soundtrack for A Touch of Evil features 18 tracks of music created specifically for the game. This includes the entire original soundtrack plus five new songs inspired by the expansions. The CD features new artwork and liner notes from the composer and TWO EXCLUSIVE NEW GAME CARDS only available with the Special Edition Soundtrack."

The two new cards are "Song of the Dead," an Event card, and "Ominous Overture," a Mystery card. Both cards are to be added directly to their respective decks.

Event: Song of the Dead

Card Text: "Play when a Hero is KO'd (including yourself). That Hero does not have to lose any Items, Allies, or Investigation for being KO'd. OR Play when a Town Elder is killed to immediately gain D6 Investigation."

Mystery: Ominous Overture

Card Text: "At the start of each Mystery Phase (including this one), each Hero gains 1 Investigation. Any time a Hero rolls a 1 for movement, they must draw a Mystery Card instead of an Event. REMAINS IN PLAY."
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Polynesia: Expansion Map
description: This expansion map provides a different configuration of routes for the base game, Polynesia.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Travel
mechanics: Network and Route Building

name: Settlers of New Catan (and extra modules)
description:
This game variant of Settlers of Catan is inspired by the universe created by Klaus Teuber in Starfarers of Catan. The game alters the original game in some important respects. Players need, however, only a copy of Settlers of Catan and some additional components that can be downloaded for free.

Players are human settlers on the first "Catanian colony" in space, called New Catan. Apart from building settlements and cities, they must also forge friendly relations with alien races that have established outposts on the planet. If the players succeed, they are rewarded with valuable benefits that will help them succeed in the game. The planet is also cursed by space pirates disguised as a robber and an infiltrator. The game has several expansions (so called Modules) of its own.

Belongs to the Catan Series.

Expands:

CATAN
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Negotiation, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Modular Board, Trading

name: Dungeon Dice: Thief Die
description:
The Thief Die is an expansion die for Dungeon Dice. It was previously only available in the Five-Player Booster Pack, but is now available on its own to add to your games of Dungeon Dice!

The Thief has already opened the chest, and is now using its contents against you. When fighting the Thief, you draw a die of the appropriate type (as shown on the bottom right of the Thief die) and roll it together with the Thiefs level dice. If you defeat him, you get to keep what the Thief tried to steal!
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Orléans: Gaming Room
description:
Supplement of the Spielbox 4/2019

Alternative for Beneficial Deed
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Religious, Travel
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Point to Point Movement, Worker Placement

name: Universal Rule: Solo AI #1
description:
After a journey through deep space, your expedition greets a new galaxy full of promise and danger. The galaxy was thought to be uninhabited, but robotic explorers have just established a colony and are already surveying additional planets. All alone in this new frontier, will you be able to overcome the relentless advance of your mechanized opposition?

Universal Rule: Solo AI #1 is a solo expansion to Universal Rule.

It can be played in one of the following ways:

1. Play using one of the base games:

Universal Rule
Second Wave
Singularity.


2. Randomize 17 Planet cards and 1 Edge card.
3. Choose your favorite combination of 17 Planet cards and 1 Edge card.


Planet:

Cinda
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Redneck Life: Bustin' A Gut! Expansion
description:
This expansion gives your game 20 more ridiculous Rigs, 10 more hilarious Homes, 50 additional Go Redneckin' Cards and all-new charts for an even wilder ride on the Redneck Life journey through Blue Collar Americana!

Expands:

Redneck Life
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Heroes of Normandie: Battleground Set II – Harbor & Hills
description:
Extend the battlefields of Normandy further with these 6 large double-sided map tiles, including the new hill terrain.

Content:

• 5 terrain tiles: Hills and Harbor
• 1 punchboard: houses and boat
• 2 scenario's
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Age of Thieves: Masters of Disguise
description:
Description from the publisher:

While master thieves hide in the shadows and plan their next moves, two new characters enter the city. At first, they don’t seem very suspicious – just an elderly lady with a rusty cat and a wandering actor. However, appearances can be deceptive and the new characters will soon prove that!

Age of Thieves: Masters of Disguise is the first expansion for the unique game Age of Thieves, in which players impersonate the masters of shadows and try to steal the precious Emperors Jewel. The expansion introduces two new characters along with miniatures, special abilities and character sheets, entirely new mechanics (burglary and sewer cards) and a unique scenario.
categories: Fantasy, Miniatures, Renaissance, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Horse & Musket III: Crucible of War
description:
Description from the publisher:

Horse & Musket: Crucible of War is the second expansion to Horse & Musket: Dawn of an Era. This volume will cover warfare from 1749-1767, when linear musket combat was at its apogee. This era was dominated by the world sweeping Seven Years' War. The war saw dramatic shifts in fortune, but when all was over Prussia survived and Britain’s empire doubled in size. In this conflict light troops and cavalry charges became more common and bold. Artillery was more accurate and heavy, with canister being used to sweep away opponents. Infantry firefights became prolonged.

The battles include...

Monongahela - July 17, 1755 – Braddock’s Defeat

Lake George - September 8, 1755 – Bloody Morning Scout

Lobositz - October 1, 1756 – “These are not the same Austrians.”

Kolin - June 18, 1757 – “Rascals, would you live forever?”

Plassey - June 23, 1757 – The Birth of British Bengal

Hastenback - July 26, 1757 – The Convention of Klosterzeven

Rossbach - November 5, 1757 – “Après nous, le deluge”

Leuthen - December 5, 1757 – Frederick II’s Greatest Victory

Krefeld - June 23, 1758 – Brunswick’s Masterpiece

Fort Carillon - July 8, 1758 – Montcalm’s Cross

Zorndorf - August 25, 1758 – Savagery on the Meitzel River

Bergen - April 13, 1759 – Krefeld Avenged

La Belle-Famille - July 24, 1759 – The Fate of Fort Niagara

Montmorecy - July 31, 1759 – Wolfe’s Bloody Blunder

Minden - August 1, 1759 – The Day of Roses

Kunersdorf - August 12, 1759 – “I believe that everything is lost”

Plains of Abraham - September 13, 1759 – “The paths of glory lead but to the grave…”

Torgau - November 3, 1760 – Zieten Saves the Day

Villinghausen - July 15-16, 1761 – Soubise’s Blunder

Freiberg - October 29, 1762 – The Last Battle of the Seven Years’ War
categories: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Dracula's Feast: Cthulhu & Friends
description:
The first expansion for Dracula's Feast adds 7 new roles, and allows up to 10 players!

The Great Old One has crashed the party and brought company: The Grim Reaper, King Kong...even an Angry Mob!

Cthulhu and Friends introduces VIP's (Visibly Imposing Partygoers) and a deck of 12 Artifacts, making every game totally different!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Memory, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Realms: Federal Transport
description:
Promo Card for Star Realms
Cost: 2
(Blue)

1 buy and 5 health
Blue: 2 buy
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Railways of the World: Mini Expansions
description:
Contents: 6 sets of 16 Mini-Expansions (a total of 96 pieces) in the 6 original Railways of the World player colors.

Use these as Hotels, Switch Tracks, Fuel Depots and Mines.

NOTE: This item was initially announced as an accessory, but it also has rules. Depending on the exact version, these were included in print, or available as a download.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Action Points, Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: The Artemis Project: "Alien Relic" Mini-Expansion
description:
This micro-expansion includes new cards that give players access to a powerful extra die!


Included with Kickstarter Edition of the base game.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Take That, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Assassin
description:
He does not obey any rules. Does not ally with anyone. Walks his own paths. Pray not to meet him.

Assassin token belongs to no faction. Any player can play it on the board instead of one of his own tokens. When placed on the board any player can play the Battle tile to activate him - instead of triggering the Battle the Assassin attacks. During a Battle he attacks no one. When killed he can be played on the board once again the same way.

Tile is available as a reward in Dice Tower Season 10, 2014 Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Table Battles: Wars of the Roses
description:
The first expansion to the popular Table Battles is set during the Wars of the Roses. Players generally have fewer morale cubes this time around, meaning that there's less of a margin for error, and a well-timed blow can be much more decisive. There are also some formations with unusual special abilities, such as Edward IV's ability to act as a "wild die" for a friendly formation. As with the base game, good play involves being aware of your own strengths while exploiting the weaknesses of your opponent.

The eight battles in this set are:

First St. Albans (22 May 1455)
Blore Heath (22 September 1459)
Mortimer's Cross (3 February 1461)
Towton (29 March 1461)
Edgecote Moor (26 July 1469)
Barnet (14 April 1471)
Tewkesbury (4 May 1471)
Stoke Field (16 June 1487)
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: L.A.M.A.: 3 Gry w 1
description: 3 in 1: L.A.M.A., L.A.M.A. Party Edition and L.A.M.A. Dice
categories: Card Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Matching

name: Alien vs Predator: Alien Warriors Expansion
description:
From the publisher:

The Warrior or Soldier is the primary assault caste of the Xenomorph species. Spawned from human hosts much like their drone counterparts a Warriors Prime role is to secure fresh hosts for their siblings and neutralize the threats to the hive
They have the strength to rip through Steel bulkheads and the durability to take several pulse rifle hits before falling to their wounds.
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Council of Verona: Corruption
description:
Alas, the corruption that dwells within us all. Oh, what scandal, what deception! Oh, what cruel manipulation of these two houses! Shall we pity them and grant them leave while these matters are sorted? Nay, the iron is indeed hot and we must strike with all intention. Fellow citizens of Verona, I plead for your joint purpose as we bring the dynasty to level. With power in excess, take what you will, and may the best of us rise to our place.

Council of Verona: Corruption is an expansion for Council of Verona that adds 21 Corruption Cards into the game. Corruption Cards may add new influence spots, be played face-up for an ongoing or instant ability or played face-down for an end-game ability or as a bluff.

Corruption Cards are dealt after the Character Card Draft and played either face-down or face-up on any Character Card on The Council or in Exile, adding an exciting additional layer of bluffing into the game. Each player will be dealt four Corruption Cards of which they will choose two to keep.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Novel-based, Renaissance
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Room 25: Dice Tower Promo 2016
description:
A new room tile which was originally available as a reward in the 2016 Dice Tower Season 12 Kickstarter.

Mr. Tom's Hall (Green Room)

Tom is neither a guard nor a prisoner, he’s a games fan and therefore a guest on the show. When you enter the room, if you give your reminder token (by discarding it permanently), you may immediately choose between seeing a hidden adjacent room, or being pushed into an adjacent room. If you refuse to give your reminder token or if you don’t have it anymore, he pushes you into an adjacent room chosen by the first player of the turn (it can be yourself).

Note: You can’t use this room in Madness mode (due to reminder tokens being absent)

History Note: Originally called Uncle Tom's Hall, but changed Room 25 publisher Matagot (a French company) once they learned of the meaning of "Uncle Tom" in America.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/tomvasel/the-dice-tower...
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Maze, Negotiation, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Memory, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Agricola: L-Deck
description:
The L-Deck is a promo card expansion for Agricola. It is comprised mostly of cards given away at Spiele Essen. Each year, the new set of promo cards are included in the L-Deck and continue the numbering from the previous years' release.

For Essen 2008, eight of the cards were printed in a 12 card set—some were included more than once—and handed out as promotional items by the people depicted on the cards.
For Essen 2009, fifteen new cards were printed in a 24 card set—some in German, some in English—and handed out as promotional items by the people depicted on the cards.

Most of 2008 and 2009 promos are included in Agricola: The Goodies Expansion.

Expands:

Agricola
categories: Animals, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement
publishers: Lookout Games, Mayfair Games, Z-Man Games

name: Last Bastion: Wu-Feng
description:
ENTRANCE AND RECURRING EFFECTS
The active player must randomly draw a Monster card from the discard pile and put it in play according to the normal rules.

EXIT EFFECT
The heroes have just claimed possession of Wu-Feng’s Urn. The card isn’t discarded, but is kept next to the Bastion and may be used by any player. Wu-Feng’s Urn is a highly precious artifact which may only be used once - it allows a wounded hero to regain their power and grants them a Call to Arms token. Once the Urn has been used, the player puts Wu-Feng’s card in the discard pile.

This card was part of the Spiel'19 preorder bundle. Later available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Explorers Pack.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Ogre: Nihon Empire – North American Divisions Sponsored Counter Sheet
description:
This Ogre unit promo pack is a result of the Ogre Designer Edition Kickstarter project, where Roy (Thirdpower) Kubicek pledged $4,500 for the creation and distribution of this set of Nihon units.

Here are the unit descriptions:

Looking at the front, left to right, top to bottom:

A Mark III-B and two Mark 1, 5 GEVs, 4 Infantry, 3 Heavy Tanks, 4 Marines, 2 Missile Tanks, 4 Light GEVs, 3 Light Tanks, 1 HW Team, 1 Missile Crawler, 1 Crawler, 5 GEV-PC, 2 SuperHeavy, 1 Mobile HWZ.

There are other assorted counters as well.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Conflict of Heroes: Guadalcanal – U.S. Army
description:
The U.S. Army Expansion covers the U.S. Army’s involvement on Guadalcanal from late October through December 1942.

Mine counters and rules are introduced in this expansion. Also included are the National Guard, Melanesian Police who assisted U.S. forces on Guadalcanal, and the Marine 2nd Raiders who arrived on Guadalcanal in November, after the Battle of Henderson Field
categories: Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Grand Cru: Heuriger und gemischter Satz
description: Two expansion tiles(three times each as the original improvements) offered at the booth of the "Östereichisches Spielemuseum" at Essen 2010. These replace two of the eight types of improvement available in the game adding additional variabilty.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding

name: Coup: Inquisition
description:
This coaster was given as Promo in Brazil.

Variant - Inquisition
Place the coaster on the table with the Inquisitor side facing up.
The coaster slightly changes the Duke gameplay:
If it shows the two Dukes the game plays with the normal rules.

While the coaster shows the Inquisitor, whenever a player influences a Duke to get 3 coins, another player may claim to influence the Inquisitor to receive 1 of the 3 coins leaving the Duke player with only 2 coins from the treasury. Players might challenge the Inquisitor as usual. In case of more than one player claiming to influence the Inquisitor, whoever has less money has preference and if they have the same amount, the Duke decides whom to give the money.

Action - Subvert
Pay one coin to the central treasury to flip the coaster.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Nerdy Red Flags: A Geeky Expansion to Red Flags
description:
Nerdy Red Flags adds 75 nerdy perks and Red Flags to your game.

Here are some examples:
Owns real Pokemon
Is your favorite Doctor
Looks exactly like Jabba the Hutt

This deck adds all kinds of nerdy goodness to your game, and has sources all across the popular and classic sci-fi, fantasy, and video-game worlds.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Storytelling

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – The Pirates of Lys
description:
Game description from the publisher:

As the Great Houses head to sea, A Game of Thrones: The Card Game - The Pirates of Lys – the third Chapter Pack from the "A Song of the Sea" cycle – develops deep synergies between their characters, events, and locations. The naval challenge enhancement features prominently, appearing on several characters and interacting with new events and locations. Finally, a new agenda promotes the cycle's themes of naval exploration and encourages radical new deck designs.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: Blue Moon: Fire Spirit
description:
Promo 903 for Blue Moon.

A Leadership card that allows you to draw and discard one card from your opponent's hand.

It is not affiliated with a people and costs one moon.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: The World of SMOG: Rise of Moloch – Kingdom Death Crossover: Steampunk Twilight Knight
description: A kickstarter-exclusive expansion optional add on. It includes the Steampunk Twilight Knight crossover character who is from the Kingdom Death: Monster game. Also included in this expansion is a model of the character as well as her own dashboard and card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Crabs Adjust Humidity: Omniclaw Edition (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
This is a combined special edition containing all the cards from Volumes One – Five of the infamous crappy little 3rd-party, unofficial expansion to Cards Against Humanity.

Includes: all 560 cards from Crabs Adjust Humidity Volumes 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5, as well as an exclusive storage box with room for future expansion.
Custom serialized hologram on every box, so you know you're not getting a counterfeit.

This is meant to be played with Cards Against Humanity. So do that.
categories: Card Game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dig Down Dwarf: Gems of Norcia!
description:
Gems of Norcia is an optional expansion for Dig Down Dwarf. It adds a catch-up mechanic to the base game. If a player ends a turn without gaining a gem, they get to draw 3 random gems from the "Gems of Norcia!" pouch.

Players gain 4 VP for every set of four different colored gems they draw from this bag over the course of the game.

Contains 20 custom 12 sided gems in four different colors, a grey suede pouch, and instructions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Ascension: Rise of Vigil – Ethereal Huntress Promo
description:
Promo that comes with the Ascension Collector's Box.

5 runes to acquire.

Gain 3 fight. You may put a Monster from the Void on top of the center deck.

Worth 3 points.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Spirits of the Rice Paddy: Solo Play Components
description:
Components for solo play consists of a Special 1-Hex Rice Paddy and 9 cards which are used each turn to control the flow of water.

Per the campaign:
These components won't be available in the retail product - only as part of this Kickstarter and afterwards directly from APE Games at an additional cost.
categories: Farming, Mythology
mechanics: Enclosure, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Monopoly Gamer: Mario Kart Power Pack – Bowser
description:
The Monopoly brand has joined forces with Mario Kart in the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game! With Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Power Packs, character tokens grant unique abilities to optimize players' gameplay experience.

For use with the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game.

Bowser's Super Star ability is: Steal 4 Coins from any player.
Bowser's Power-Up (activated by rolling a Spiny shell) is: The player with the most Coins drops 3. All other players drop 1. You drop none.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Asking for Trobils: Companions
description:
Companions is an expansion to "Asking for Trobils".

Space is lonely, but when the lost colony ship, the Friend, appeared on the outskirts of the star system, everyone was thrilled to hear about it. Even more exciting, the Friend Ship contains a new resource, Shards, that provides another way to capture Trobils!

The residents of this ship are eager to explore the galaxy with you. If you let them tag along, despite their silly quirks, they'll give you these Shards to help rid the galaxy of Trobils.

Companion cards are randomly paired with a Shard card and placed in a new player board that includes a Dial. The Dial helps show players where to place Shards and points to the active Quirk of the Companion.

These pairs of cards are obtained by visiting the Friend Ship location. Shards are valuable, so players will strategize how to best navigate the Quirks of their Companion in order to gain as many Shards as they can without interrupting the efficiency of their Trobil hunting.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Race

name: Dungeon Heroes: Expansion Pack
description:
Part of the Dungeon Heroes Kickstarter campaign, the Dungeon Heroes: Expansion Pack contains two modules for the base game.

The Dragon & The Damsel, which features an exciting classic tale of rescuing a damsel in distress from an all powerful dragon. If you rescue the damsel, she joins the party as a 5th Hero and lends her aid to your quest for treasure. Be careful though, for while you are searching for her you may encounter the toughest monster yet, the Dragon!

Lords of the Undead, which features the ghostly story of a lady long forgotten and a necromancer dabbling in dark magic. Amongst this angst, the Heroes come across an underground marketplace offering its help.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Medieval, Memory
mechanics: Action Points, Memory, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Project: ELITE – Ammo Pack
description:
The Kickstarter Exclusive Ammo Pack brings a new set of rules, to emerge in the battlefield, and a new type of equipment!

The Ammo Pack is designed to emerge players in the battlefield and offer new challenges.

All non-basic weapons become limited ammo weapons. When a Weapon is equipped, players must add Ammo tokens to their cards. In order to use a Weapon, one token must be spent. Once all the tokens have been spent, the Weapon is inactive and can’t be used to attack or have its effects applied.

But that is no motive to panic. New ammo can be acquired by reaching an Ammo Crate and performing a Search action, with no limit to the amount of players that can do the action at the same time. Ammo Crates can also be moved to adjacent spaces, in case the location is invaded and becomes too dangerous.

The Ammo pack brings grenades as a new kind of weapon. Grenades can be thrown to a fixed position, causing damage and different effects depending on the Grenade's type.

All grenades have the same range and chance to hit, but depending on the dice result the grenade may hit closer or further locations.

There are three types of grenades:

Explosive Grenades: Deal 2 damage on the space it hits and 1 damage on all adjacent spaces.
Smoke Bomb: All Aliens in the hit and adjacent locations can’t move, can’t be pushed, and don’t activate until next round.
Repellant Gas: All aliens in the hit and adjacent locations must move against the Movement Path when moving or activating inside the area. The effect lasts until the next round.


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Real-time, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Viceroys: Expansion Set 1 – Columbus
description:
Supplementary expansion kit to commemorate the 500th anniversary of Columbus' first famous voyage.

Adds the following:

Rules for China
Extra pieces to support an 8th player
Rules and counters to support the following:
natural wonders
special discoveries
leader values
missions and colonial improvements

48 additional cards
8th office (the Waiter)
Extra rules:
variable player order
land movement
boarding parties
hasty fortifications
colonial construction
growth of native empires
technology upgrades
minimum income
national revival

Additional scenarios:
Chinese Admiral of the Ocean
China and Quick Start empires
additional random events

Strategy Guide: Pillage, Plunder and Piracy
Strategy Guide: To the Antipodes!
Errata
Rating Scale and VP Point Tally Sheets
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Die Portale von Molthar: Sonderkarten
description:
Die Portale von Molthar: Sonderkarten contains two language independent playing cards: Joker-Perlenkarte and Tischlein deck dich, and 1 German rules card.

Included in the Spielbox Essen Spiel special edition 2015.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Warhammer 40,000: Heroes of Black Reach – Zoggrim the Kharnager
description:
Description from the publisher:

Zogrim ate all his opponents, he finds his pleasure in the bloody bath of violence on the battleground where his famous shout resounds and makes the weaks tremble ! KHARNAGE!

Content:

Zogrim the Kharnager

Only available on game events or during promotional operations.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue

name: Splendor: Dice Tower Promo Noble
description:
Promotional noble offered by "Dice Tower Season 13 Indiegogo".

Requires 4 blue and 4 black to claim this noble for 3 points.

Works like any other noble and is just mixed into any game of Splendor that includes nobles. Cannot be used with the "Cities of Splendor" module in Cities of Splendor expansion
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Renaissance
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Dice Hospital: Inspector Administrator Promo Card
description:
Administrator card for Dice Hospital.

Backers of the Coral Islands Kickstarter received this promo for free if they Kickstarted Dice Hospital.

It features a new one-time only ability and Sabrina Miramon has captured the likeness of Tom Vasel for the upcoming Dice Tower Kickstarter campaign.

Once per game you may remove this card from the game during the improvement phase. When it is your turn to choose an improvement, instead, you may look through the specialist card deck and take a specialist of your choice as your improvement that round
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Medical
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Beez: Fly, Butterfly!
description:
A magnificent butterfly has landed gracefully in the garden. Quick! Catch up with it before it flutters away to another flower! You'll be handsomely rewarded if you do!

With the Fly, Butterfly mini-expansion, players will add butterfly tiles to replace leaf tiles from the base game and place the butterfly on one of these new butterfly tiles to start the game. Whenever a player's bee lands on a tile adjacent to the butterfly, the player will get an option to move a stored nectar to a different empty chamber without the normal restrictions. Then that player gets to move the butterfly to a different butterfly tile.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pattern Building

name: Dungeon Drop: Phase Shifter
description:
Promo card for Dungeon Drop.

A magical new class for Dungeon Drop. Phase shift your way through the very dungeon walls in order to acquire maximum riches!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Enclosure, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Battleforce 2
description:
"Take your station in the headquarters bunker for the challenge of a MechWarriors lifetime! This is your chance to command an entire army in futuristic combat on distant planets. Every kind of weapon available to a 31st century general is at your disposal, including tanks, hovercraft, helicopters, infantry, artillery, and the 30-foot tall humanoid juggernauts called BattleMechs, the most powerful and versatile weapons of war ever devised. They await your orders. Do you have what it takes to lead these awesome forces to victory?"

Battleforce 2 is the Battletech game of combat on a grand scale.

Battleforce 2 is a fast-paced, easy to play game that recreates large 'mech combat on a tactical level. This system retains the feel of Battletech by providing simple stats for each individual Mech and tank, yet play is streamlined enough that players can set up and play through a massive-scale battle of entire battalions and regiments in a single evening.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Wanted! Dead or Alive
description:
This is a compilation of BANG! and the expansions BANG! Dodge City, BANG! High Noon, and BANG! A Fistful of Cards.

This card game recreates an old-fashioned spaghetti western shoot-out, with each player randomly receiving a Character card to determine special abilities, and a secret Role card to determine their goal. A player's Role is kept secret, except for the Sheriff. Character cards are placed face-up on table, and also track strength (hand limit) in addition to special ability.
categories: American West, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: The New Science: Fantasy Scientists
description:
The New Science: Fantasy Scientists is a small expansion forThe New Science that adds five new scientists for players to choose from:


Albert Einstein
Marie Curie
Nikola Tesla
Thomas Edison
Charles Darwin

description:
From the packaging:

Now it's easy to customize Fluxx!

All you need is a Fluxx deck, a permanent marker, and a little bit of imagination, and you can add your own favorite concepts and wacky game ideas to the card game with ever changing rules!

[Bonus! Chrononauts expansion card inside!]

Note: The current edition of Fluxx Blanxx has one of each type of card (including the Creeper but not the Ungoal) and it does not have the bonus Chrononauts card.

Part of the Fluxx series.
