description:
You can use these 71 cards to randomly determine which bank chips to use for each game of Puzzle Strike. You can also use them to choose random characters. Contains 51 puzzle chip cards (covering all puzzle chips in the base game, Shadows expansion, and promo chips) as well as all 20 characters (10 from base game, 10 from the Shadows) expansion.
(from the Sirlin Games webpage)
categories: Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: HexPack – Cities and Roads
description:
Publisher Blurb:

You've defeated your opponent across all the terrain that the BattleTech Introductory Box Set has to offer and now you want more worlds to conquer. Grab your dice and start rolling, because this product is for you!

HexPack: Cities and Roads is a flexible map system aid for the BattleTech game system. Designed for use in conjunction with other pre-printed mapsheets (such as those from the Introductory Box Set), the system’s flexibility allows for easy modifications to existing mapsheets, increasing the enjoyment of a given scenario as players quickly change the terrain to bring new excitement to each game they play! A booklet contains two ready-to-play scenarios, which include expanded play options such as clearing woods, buildings and additional weather conditions.

Contents:

-One 18″ x 22″ full-color gameboard-quality mapsheet, with a different map printed on either side.
-Four punch-out-and-ready-to-play gameboard-quality HexTile sheets.
-Sixteen page booklet.

Miniatures not included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Martial Art: Battlefields
description:
The battle continues for feudal Japan in this expansion to Martial Art. Battlefields introduces two new mechanics: terrain and weather.

Terrain cards may be played before battle to augment your battle card and affect the outcome. Because terrain is played before battle but the effects don't happen until later, other players may guess your intention and act accordingly. Alternatively, terrain may be used as a feint to trick your opponents before you surprise them with an unexpected battle card.

Weather cards are shuffled into the land deck at the start of the game. When a weather card is drawn, its effect continues until a new weather is drawn to replace it. Weather will affect the battles in unpredictable ways, forcing you to adapt your strategy to what the battlefield is giving you. Will you charge your troops through the snow to capture a valuable bridge? Will you send your troops to battle during a severe drought? It is up to you to decide if the risk is worth the reward.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Munchkin Chibithulhu Plush
description:
Part of the Munchkin series

These soft and huggable plush figures features huge, adorable eyes, a loving heart on the chest... and Cthulhu's trademark tentacles.

There are many variants of the Chibithulhu Plush:

10" Chibithulhu (available in green or pink)
10" Christmas Chibithulhu (white with a red Christmas cap and a snowflake on its chest)
10" Halloween Chibithulhu (orange with a black witch's cap and a jack-o-lantern on its chest)
10" July 4 Chibithulhu (light blue with a red, white, and blue top hat and a firecracker on its chest)
10" Zombie Chibithulhu (gray with a pink brain on its chest)
20" Mega Chibithulhu (green only)
4" Mini Chibithulhu (available in red, green, blue, purple, or black/silver)


Special Rule:


Chibithulhu can be used to help you in any Munchkin Cthulhu game, or any Munchkin Blender game using Cultist cards.



Chibithulhu must be in the room when you begin play in order to help you. Each Chibithulhu can only help one person per game.



Chibithulhu can act once per game, any time combat is not going on, to either get you into the Cult (if a Cultist card is available in the discards) or free you (discard your Cultist card).



Only one Chibithulhu can help you during the game. Exception: If the game is at your house (apartment, condo, tent, secret lair, whatever), you may have two Chibithulhus of different colors, and each one can help you once.


The Zombie Chibithulu has a special rule for Munchkin Zombies. See the board game version for details.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Zombies
mechanics: Variable Player Powers

name: Dien Bien Phu: The French Indochina War
description: Crtical Hit module for "Squads and Leaders" (read: Advanced Squad Leader)covering tactical battles during the French Indochina Wars of the mid-1950's. Includes extensive variant rules, 15 scenarios, 4 maps (3 of the 8x22, unmounted, and 1 large historical map) plus a few overlays and a great whack of variant counters depicting PAVN and French (including French Foreign and T'ai irregulars) troops and weapons. **NOTE** Although CH has a printed caveat on the box that ownership of Beyond Valor, Croix de Guerre and West of Alamein are required they FAIL to indicate that mapboards from Gung Ho are also required in order to play a handful of the scenarios.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Prehistory: Kickstarter Exclusives
description:
Extras not included in the retail version:

4 extra fish tokens (fish trap)
5 extra gathering tokens (mushroom)
9 extra megalith tokens (4 double points, 5 income)
5 extra animal tokens (sloth)
40 customized warriors
12 customized shaman
4 customized fishing markers (fish)
4 customized development markers (tusks)
8 customized ceremony markers (fires)
7 unique characters with abilities
Marauders solo mode (playable with 1-3 players):
1 marauder board and tokens
6 special map tiles
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Prehistoric
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac – Dalia Cardoso
description:
A mini-expansion for The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac. Gives an extra (13th) Adventurer character to choose from.
Dalia Cardoso comes as a pre-painted mini, with a card describing her special ability: Coercion (once per game, if she is on the same space as another Adventurer at any time during her turn, she can persuade her/him to carry one of her treasures for her). Other than that, the base game rules are not impacted.

Available in limited quantities at a few conventions & retailers in 2010, and as a special offer in Ravage magazine #65, #66, #69.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Memory, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Alderac Entertainment Group, Dust Games, Edge Entertainment

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Mask of the Archmaester
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Mask of the Archmaester, the fifth monthly Chapter Pack in the Secrets of Oldtown cycle of expansions for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, introduces 60 cards - three copies each of 20 never-before-seen locations, attachments, characters, events, and plots to aid your A Game of Thrones deckbuilding goals. This Chapter Pack features more Chain attachments as well as more diverse and surprising events and support for the ever-deepening Maester trait.

New characters from George R.R. Martin's A Song of Ice and Fire are introduced into the Living Card Game environment for the first time, including Ser Jon Fossoway and The Mad Mouse. Exciting new versions of existing characters will also enter the fold, including a Rickon Stark that will aid House Stark's deck-searching capabilities. Watch out as sub-themes expand further, including House Dayne's Starfall Cavalry, Iron Fleet Raiders, and more!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Game Harbor, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag, Stratelibri

name: Ogre: Kickstarter Exclusive Overlays Counter Sheets
description:
This Ogre unit promo pack is a result of the Ogre Kickstarter project. These set was one of several given as a Backer Exclusive Promo.

The second of three exclusive Kickstarter counter sheets has a variety of map overlays not found in the standard set of Ogre Designer's Edition. Large cities, rivers and lakes, a marshy delta, and more, providing additional map customization and scenario building options!

This double sheet set includes Sheets M1 and M2.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Ancient Horrors Enemy Pack
description:
Tearing their way through the Void, these nightmare creatures are masses of writhing tentacles and ancient hate! Burrowing through realities, once manifested into a physical form, they lay dormant beneath the earth, sometimes for millennia; waiting with vile intent as they writhe in their hibernation. Most often, these Ancient Horrors are awakened from their dread repose by the smell of Dark Stone, or the call of some malign and eldritch being of great power, summoning evil to do its bidding.

This Enemy Pack contains everything you need to add these ancient and terrifying, creatures to your games of Shadows of Brimstone! There are 2 Extra large Ancient Horror models included, as well as the large Enemy Record Sheet and all of the Threat Cards needed to add them to your games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin 7+8
description: Munchkin 7+8 contains the contents of both Munchkin 7: Cheat With Both Hands and Munchkin 8: Half Horse, Will Travel.
categories: Unspecified
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Lifeform: Thirteenth Passenger
description:
The 13th Passenger expansion for Lifeform is a modular, plug-in expansion for hardcore players who want even more!
There are four optional modules:


Two new characters join the Crew team.
New rules for asteroids add yet another terrifying threat to the already beleaguered Valley Forge starship.
The Remora shuttle board provides a brand new and unique endgame showdown experience.
And the new Crisis cards enable a lone player to use the Remora, and expand the solo experience.


This expansion was originally available as an add-on during the Kickstarter campaign for Lifeform.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin 6: Double Dungeons
description:
Double Trouble!
What's an adventurer without dungeons to explore? This box contains 40 double-sized Dungeons plus 32 Portals to get you from one to the next. Each Dungeon changes the rules... some are helpful, some are harmful, and some are just silly. It's Munchkin, after all!

This set includes the cards from Munchkin 6: Demented Dungeons and Munchkin 6.5: Terrible Tombs, now in a single convenient expansion!

-from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: No Thank You, Evil!: Story, Please!
description:
Description from the publisher:

No Thank You, Evil!: Story, Please! is a one hundred-card deck stuffed full of evocative art and creative ideas, letting you quickly build hundreds of unique adventures for No Thank You, Evil!

To use these new cards, combine an engaging STORY card with one or more cool PLACE and PERSON cards to outline your quest. Then give your adventure a surprising TWIST, and some cool STUFF. Map and handout cards complete the adventure. The deck is the same size as the cards in the original game, allowing you to use it with the Creature and Cypher Cards from that game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Reanimates – Unit Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

Expand your ranks of the undead with the Runewars Miniatures Game: Reanimates – Unit Expansion. The expansion features eight Reanimate plastic figures in four different sculpts for use with the forces of Waiqar, as well as five upgrade cards to customize your forces, no matter your faction allegiance. Raise your dead with the Reanimates Expansion Pack and claim all of Terrinoth for Waiqar the Undying!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Barcelona: New Corner Buildings
description:
Promo from Board&Dice when you pre-ordered the game at their website.

Content: four level 2 corner buildings and two level 3.

Set-up: Mix in with the others.

Description: When constructing a Building you can use the new corner Buildings to overbuild. Contrary to the normal rules, these must be built in order: the level 2 corner Building may be placed only over level 1, and level 3 over level 2. Also, you must use the depicted citizens to do it, putting them in their respective tracks as per normal rules. Place your marker
on top of the new Building and score Victory Points, but you do not get any extra reward or penalty for constructing
them.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Harpoon: Battles of the Third World War – Modern Naval Warfare Scenarios
description:
Covers 15 scenarios for the Harpoon system of modern naval warfare. These 15 scenarios cover the hypothetical war between NATO and Soviet forces during the 1980's.


The Harpoon Series
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Cards Against Humanity: Weed Pack
description:
Description from the pblisher:

Hey man, I know I was supposed to get you the website content for the Weed Pack, but I got really high and this is all I have so far haha.


Cannabis, also known as marijuana among several other names, is a psychoactive drug from the Cannabis plant intended for medical or recreational use.
something about mass incarceration
30 (?) brand new cards about weed
Def mention profits go to the Marijuana Policy Project (to regulate and tax marijuana like alcohol)
taco bell near me
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Guilds of London: Solo Rules
description: A single card and solo rules given for free at Essen 2016
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management

name: Viral: Plague Promo Card
description:
Promo mutation card for Viral that gives you 4 actions: you can place 2 of your viruses in the zone whom you combined this mutation card with and you get 2 movements.
At the end of the game this card is worth 0 victory points.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medical
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Arcane Wonders, Corax Games, Edge Entertainment, Ediciones MasQueOca, MEBO Games, MESAboardgames

name: Battle for Armageddon Expansion Set: Chaos Attack
description:
Chaos Attack is an expansion for the Battle for Armageddon game. The expansion adds new rules and counters to the original game, and also provides an alternate setting that depicts chaos invasion that took place on the planet centuries before the Orks even touched the planet.

The game allows for 2 new Orc Clans, alternate rules for Squats and Inquisitors instead of Space Marines and an entire set of play cards and unit tokens for playing as the invading Chaos forces.

Games Workshop re-released the game as a free download during the 2000 "Third War for Armageddon" worldwide campaign event. The re-release of the board game (and it's parent game, Battle for Armageddon) was available for free. However, as of December 2008, the link is dead as a result of GW's website redesign.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Set Collection

name: Fancy Feathers: It is getting colorful!
description:
New pheasants are spotted on the path. Thus, you immediately hit the trail to offer your baroness some variety of game.

This first expansion for Fancy Feathers offers 6 new types of animal cards.

Look out for the Crested Fireback, Sumatran Pheasant, Kokass Pheasant, Eared Pheasant, the Barking Dog, and use the Long Hand Net.

Same as the base game of Fancy Feathers, this expansion works with up to six players, but to play with more than two people, you need additional copies of the expansion to have the required numbers of animal cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Map Addition, Set Collection, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Set-up

name: Feudality: The King Promo Card
description:
This promo card was handed out at the Z-Man booth at Spiel 2011 in Essen.

The card reads: The King is attending SPIEL Essen.
In turn order, each player tries a Secret Amorous Liaison with the Queen until one player succeeds.

It is to be used with the base game as it has a normal F-back.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Kaosball: Team – Felinia Hellcats
description:
“Domination. That’s the sport.”

-The Master, coach

The Hellcats bring their military tactics from the DMZ of Felinia, and look out any team that stands in their way! Their unique ability to use fallen foes as scoring mounds makes them incredibly versatile. Will they simply kill you for trophies? Or dominate you for points?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Sports
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Handsome: The Brilliant Expansion
description:
5 card expansion for an extra challenge:

1 tiebreaker card
1 hyphen card
1 set of noun, verb and adjective cards



Tiebreaker - The player that is in last place receives this card and will win ties.
Hyphen - Add this to your games for a real challenge.
Noun Verb Adjective - Adds some optional restrictions and some press your luck. If your word fits the category in play, the value of the word goes up by 1. But you have to choose which suit when you write down your word.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Zooloretto: Tapir
description:
Special printing for "Stadt-Land-Spielt" (German parlour games day) 2013.

This expansion to Zooloretto adds a tapir.

Use the normal rules for Zooloretto, except for one rule: the first player to fill his 6-space enclosure, takes the tapir enclosure from the middle of the table.
Once per game the owner of the tapir enclosure [in addition to his normal action before or after it] may pay 1 coin to exchange all pieces of a species from his zoo with all pieces of a species from another player's zoo.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Zombicide (2nd Edition): Nico
description:
Nico is a promotional character (miniature plus character card) for Zombicide 2nd Edition.

A master of wielding dual katanas.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Zombies
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game
publishers: BoardM Factory, CMON Global Limited, Guillotine Games

name: Car Wars Supplements: The AADA Road Atlas and Survival Guides
description:
The AADA Road Atlas and Survival Guide was a seven volume series of supplements for GURPS Autoduel and Car Wars. They mixed detailed background information on the Autoduel future with scenarios for Car Wars, the latter of which are most applicable here.

The volumes—all covered by this entry—are:

Volume One: The East Coast – Delaware, Maryland, New England, New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Virginia, West Virginia
Volume Two: The West Coast – California, Oregon, Washington
Volume Three: South – Alabama, Arkansas, Carolinas, Florida, Georgia, Kentucky, Mississippi, Tennessee
Volume Four: Australia – Includes the petrol rules for GURPS Autoduel
Volume Five: The Midwest – Dakotas, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Nebraska, Ohio, Wisconsin
Volume Six: The Free Oil States – Louisiana, Oklahoma, Texas
Volume Seven: Mountain West – Colorado, Deseret (Utah), Idaho, Montana, Wyoming


Part of the Car Wars Series.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Racing
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Carcassonne: Darmstadt
description:
This expasion consists of 3 tiles:

Darmstadtium (the place where Darmstadt Spielt takes place since 2010): to be placed inside a city. The winner of this city gains 3 extra points
Kirche St. Ludwig (Church of St. Ludwig): to be played like a cloister. The player with the most meeples on the church and the 8 tiles surrounding it gains 3 extra points
Russische Kapelle (Russian Chapel): same as the Church of St. Ludwig


It is part of a die-cut sheet, 20 Jahre Darmstadt Spielt. To mark his 20th anniversary the play group "Spielekreis Darmstadt" published a die-cut sheet with mini expansions to five popular games:

• Carcassonne
• Hugo, das Schlossgespenst (aka: Midnight Party)
• Die Siedler von Catan (aka: The Settlers of Catan)
• Village Port
• Zooloretto

The die-cut sheet was sold during the event "Darmstadt plays" from Nov. 15 through 16, 2014 and before that at the fair "Spiel" in Essen from Oct. 16 through 19, 2014 at the magazine "Spielerei". It can still (June 2015) be ordered via the homepage. Part of the Carcassonne series.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement

name: Borderlands Expansion Set #1
description:
The first expansion to Eon's popular Borderlands game.

This expansion adds three island territories along with 12 Bridge and 12 Ship tokens to make use of them. The set also includes 20 tokens for a fifth player. Production sites 1 forest, 1 horse breeding grounds, 1 coal mine, 1 iron mine, and 1 gold mine

Expands:

Borderlands
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Territory Building
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Bootleggers: Thug Promo
description:
This 8-card mini expansion for Bootleggers was originally released in 2013 in connection with the Mayday Games re-release of the game. It is a set of Thugs to be added to the game, and consists of the following cards:

Honorary Mayor - Collect all the graft normally paid to the bank this turn.
Potent Mash - Roll an extra die of production at a single still. May affect Copper's placement of enforcement.
Payroll Tax - Force a player to pay $1G per influence marker he controls.
County Line - Play on a loaded truck. Crates fall off the truck during a chase. Discard half the loaded crates (rounded up) from the truck.
Army Buddy - Play when an opponent plays an influence card. Receive the same influence.
You Got the Wrong Guy, See - Redirect the target of a Men of Action card to another player (but not the player of the card).
Friends in High Places - Reroll a single die of your choice, discard after use. The die need not be your own.
I Gots an Idear - Play on a truck. A trailer is permanently added to the truck which expands its capacity by 2 crates.
categories: Unspecified
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Nuclear War Booster Packs
description:
This 47-card expansion for Nuclear War is packaged in 8-card booster packs (inspired by the success Magic: The Gathering).

The cards appear different numbers of times on the press sheet, giving different levels of "rarity", and the boosters are more or less random. They are packed in clear plastic, with a cover/proof of purchase card (40 of the proof of purchase cards can be sent in for a free Supergerm T-shirt).

The new cards are mostly Secrets (20) and Specials (19), with three new sizes of Propaganda, four new sizes of Warhead, and one new Delivery System.

To incorporate this expansion into an existing Nuclear War/Escalation/Proliferation deck while preserving the existing balance of card types and strengths requires using a bunch of the new Propaganda and Warhead cards; to preserve the proportion of delivery systems, you either have to use a lot of the Delta Clipper or scavenge some extra "regular" delivery systems (perhaps a use for the ads/jokers from Nuclear War, or some of the blanks available from Flying Buffalo).

Expands:

Nuclear War


Microbadge

Buy It
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Negotiation, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: Québec: Hitchcock à Québec
description:
Promo card that will be first hand out at Spiel 2011.

It is a 4th century event. When you reveal it, remove the normal Cultural leader and replace it with this one. When you choose this leader, activate your worker(s) as per the normal rule. Then, immediately score the zone of power of your choice. Each worker in that zone grants his owner 1 VP. No workers may cascade; they stay in place (and will be scored again at the end of the century). This leader has no other effect for the rest of the century.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Worker Placement

name: Age of Steam Expansion: 20,000 Rails Under the Sea
description:
This Age of Steam Expansion expands the game to rails under the sea.

The unique aspect of this expansion is its modular nature, as players build the map as the game progresses and have to lay their rail under the sea rather than on land.

This expansion was produced for Essen 2006, and only 180 copies were printed.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Nautical, Pirates, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement, Variable Phase Order

name: Maestro Leonardo: Codex Leonardi – III
description:
This expansion for Maestro Leonardo (Leonardo da Vinci) was distributed in Essen 2007 to the buyers at the stand of daVinci games and adds the Edicts to the city.

Once the council area has been resolved, players move their men onto one of the four areas of the Edicts. The Edict with the highest number of men is in force for the current turn. Each of the Edicts has a different effect, e.g. the first one gives 2 additional Florins for each completed invention.

Expands:

Leonardo da Vinci
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Renaissance
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Abluxxen: Sonderkarten / Duell
description:
A set of 6 special cards and a rule sheet with a 2-player variant for the game.

There is one special card for 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 8 of a kind. A player who plays down any of these combinations, may take that card (or steal it from another player). Each card is worth 5 points at game end.

The rules sheet offers a "Duel" variant for two players.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Big Love Letter
description:
A postcard expansion explaining how to play up to 8 players with 2 sets of base game "Love Letter" / "Munchkin Loot Letter"

Rules are in German, released officialy by Pegasus Spiele.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Renaissance
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Kaleidos: 2009 Expansion
description:
The Kaleidos: 2009 Expansion, which was available only at Spiel 2009, includes four new pictures for the "Cocktail game/Ystari" edition of Kaleidos. The images each depict a scene packed (to greater and lesser extents) with various objects.

In Kaleidos, each of up to four players or teams uses identical scenes and a deck of cards provides a letter for the round. Everyone gets sixty seconds to write down as many things beginning with that letter as they can find in the scene. Once time has expired, any object on multiple lists scores one point for those who wrote it. Any item unique to a single list scores three points.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Pattern Recognition

name: Fiesta de los Muertos: La Catrina
description:
1 box: 3 expansions!
La Catrina contains 3 expansions for Fiesta de los Muertos (each of those requiring the base game).
The first one, La Catrina, introduces a "Campaign mode" in which you'll try to colorize the flowers on La Catrina's hat, worn by "the Dame of Death". Cooperation is more important than ever!
The second one, The Processions, adds 84 new names, divided in 6 themes. Each round, pick 2 categories at random and play with these 2 only.
The third one, The Dead are back, adds 70 names to the base game and 6 new restrictions.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Starship Catan: 2. Mission – The Asteroid
description:
Description from the www.catan.com homepage:
"A gigantic asteroid threatens the planet Teldur. We are asked to help evacuating the Teldurians."

Contents:
12 adventure cards
35 refugee groups
6 passenger groups
Planet Teldur

This is a download expansion set for Starship Catan which can be obtained from the Starship Catan website.

Also included in issue #6 of the magazine Undefeated!

Part of the Catan Series.

Expands:

Starship Catan
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Memory, Trading

name: Dino Dude Ranch: Deluxe Velociraptor Expansion
description:
The Deluxe Velociraptor Expansion adds Velociraptors to Dino Dude Ranch, which brings a new scoring mechanic.

The deluxe expansion also upgrades the food resource pieces from punchboard tokens to custom cut wooden tokens.
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Carriers
description:
The Przewoźnicy is a single tile supplement for Neuroshima Hex! 3.0. Till the end of 2016, it will be only available to the participants of the Polish Neuroshima Hex Championship tournaments.

Tile type:
Instant Action tile - At the beginning of the game players draw lots who will have it (who will start with it).
Doesn't count towards the hand size limit of 3 tiles. It's an additional tile.

Description of Przewoźnicy:
It is a normal Instant Action Move tile, but it is doubled (meaning 1 or 2 spaces move), plus rotation.
After playing it, you give it to your opponent.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Kharnage: The Devil Pigs – Army Expansion
description:
Kickstarter Exclusive 5th Army

They say everything is good to eat in a pig...
It's probably true, unless said pig is trying to chop off your head with a blade the size of a windmill sail!
A Kickstarter army is also going to try and conquer the hill.

Uuiiiiii! Pigs are rising and they are angry! They are tired to be smoked, roasted and eaten. Now, they choose you to be the meat! Welcome to a nice BBQ human/orc/goblin/dwarf ribs.

The only one to have a chance to not be eaten are the undead, because, even if everybody says pigs can eat everything, dead flesh is still disgusting!

They said it would never be done, but here it is! Module R10 includes new plasma torpedo options and variants of the New Heavy Cruisers, giving all of those War Cruiser Variants increased combat power and survival.

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – A Journey's End
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The dwarf shrugged. "Do you want to wager your throne upon a woman's whim? Go to Westeros, though ... ah, then you are a rebel, not a beggar. Bold, reckless, a true scion of House Targaryen, walking in the footsteps of Aegon the Conqueror. A dragon."
–George R.R. Martin, A Dance with Dragons

A Journey's End is the sixth and final Chapter Pack in the "A Song of the Sea" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game! Will your journey end in ruin or conquest? The pack's sixty new cards (three copies each of twenty different cards) launch players into heated naval battles and chaotic melees with five new Warships, five cards to support the game's Melee keyword, Mercenary lords, renowned Captains, and three new Prayers for the devout as they call to the Seven for guidance.

A Journey's End also concludes the "A Song of the Sea" cycle with three new cards to support the naval () enhancement. Each of the Great Houses has wagered its future upon a path it hopes will lead toward dominion over the Seven Kingdoms. At A Journey's End, it is time for you to throw in your lot. Will you wager your shot at the throne upon a whim? Or will you steer a true course – bold, direct, and fearless – as a conquerer come to claim your birthright?
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: Carcassonne: La Porxada
description:
La Porxada is a historical building in the town of Granollers. It was built in mid-16th century by order of the town council. At that time it was a cattle market and a place to trade agricultural commodities.

Carcassonne - La Porxada is a very-very-very little and semi-unofficial expansion for the game Carcassone (only 1 tile!); designed by Klaus-Jürgen Wrede and Oriol Comas i Coma.

It was available for those who took part in the National Carcassonne Tournament'2010 of Spain inside the Jugarxjugar'2010 Fair in Granollers city.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement

name: Kaosball: Team – New Victoria Klockwerks
description:
“Yes, yes, Kaosball – to the death. But can we not be gentlemen about it?” -The Surgeon, coach

Elegant and poised gadgeteers hailing from New Victoria, the Klockwerks bring their unique brand of weaponized sportsmanship to Kaosball. Their explosive tactics on the field are highly advanced, with the ability to knock enemies right down the scoreboard – with possibly disastrous side effects!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Dice Hospital: Medical Officer Administrator Promo Card
description:
Administrator card for Dice Hospital.

Backers of the Dice Hospital Kickstarter received this promo for free if they Kickstarted Pocket Sub.

Medical Officer: Once each round you may use a department on your starting hospital board a second time.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Medical
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Samarkand Bazaar
description:
Sid Sackson's classics Samarkand & Bazaar are now combined as two games in one box with this new edition of both games.

Samarkand is a fast-paced trading and selling game set in exotic Asia Minor. Cunning Merchants buy, exchange, and sell goods to build wealth. When visiting Nomad Camps and after offering gifts for their hosts’ hospitality, Merchants trade for the goods they desire. When visiting Oases, they may purchase random goods. Ultimately, these Merchants travel to the bazaars in Cities such as Samarkand or Isfahan to sell the goods they have acquired. Merchants must plan which desert paths to use to travel efficiently between the Nomad Camps, Oases, and Cities so they can earn the quickest (and greatest) profit!

In Bazaar, players attempt to gain the right combination of colored cubes through skillful trading to purchase the wares displayed in the Bazaar. Values of the various wares are determined by the number of cubes the purchaser has left over following the transaction. Trading is governed by the current rates posted at the Exchange. When the wares from two stalls have been completely sold, the Bazaar is closed, and the game ends. The player with the highest score wins!

-description from publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Math, Puzzle
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Square Grid, Trading

name: Atlantis: Ikarus Expansion
description: A free give-away at Essen 2011, expansion of Atlantis. It contains 7 new cards with two colors on each, easier to reach and useful to draw more cards and fly over the gaps. The expansion tiles don't have values but show a "draw an extra card" symbol on them.

description: This expansion for Dawn Under brings some "fresh air" to the crypts. The box contains wooden figurines for Count Rucola and 12 bats. Rucola reserves a grave for the player who controls him, while the bats give the players a chance to gamble a bit.

The Big Guns contains 5 copies each of 16 different cards, plus 4 additional warcaster cards, to bring new strategies to your Cygnar, Khador, Protectorate of Menoth, and Cryx decks.

Requires Warmachine: High Command core set to play.

description:
It's time to crank up the stank!

These cards add more rank actions to do against the other players! Buy some air fresheners because this expansion is a real gas!

Includes 18 new cards, plus a Room and Clutter!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Environmental
mechanics: Player Elimination

name: Winterhaven Woods: Winterhaven Wonders
description:
Winterhaven Wonders is an expansion to Winterhaven Woods. It introduces 3 new card types:

WINTERHAVEN LEGENDS - These cards change up how each species works during the game. They add a level of variability to each game, and give you a new strategies to focus on. They are shuffled into the Woods deck and when they come up in your hand they are placed in the center of the table. You draw a card to replace it in your hand, just like wolves in 2P. They then affect all players for the rest of the game because no one player can own a Legend.

MOTHER NATURE CARDS - These cards are drafted and played into a players meadow during the plant and populate phase. They may then be used on a future round to alter play.

VARIABLE BONUSES - These bonuses randomize the end game scoring bonuses from game to game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Environmental
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: Dice Forge: Chimera
description:
This card replaces another one from the Hydra deck. This card has no effect, you only gain victory points.

During the setup, if you are playing with the Hydra cards, replace one of the Hydra cards with the promotional card in question.
The cards will be placed in the pile in ascending order:
Hydra > Harpies > Chimera > Mother of monsters

This card is given out by the publisher during official initiations to Dice Forge.

mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Galaxy of Trian: Wormholes
description: This expansion includes 4 additional Vortex tiles. They have similar function as the teleport, although their range of effect is greater: 12 surrounding tiles instead of 3.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Master Thieves: Expansion Cards
description:
An expansion set for the base game. This adds a set of 8 Robber cards along with rules in German, English, French and Spanish on how he affects the game.

The robber can steal from the thieves and the master thieves. If a thief or a master thief finds jewels, and a robber has been played, the robber's may steal one of the jewels starting in numeric order as in the cards. A robber may not steal the last jewel a thief has found. After stealing, the robber card is discarded.

The robber may also take a thief or a master thief as prisoner. If the thief or master thief drops jewels from the drawer, the robber may exchange the robber card with the thief or master thief card.

The robber never touches the cube.

The expansion was a give-away at Essen 2006 at the Zoch Spiel booth. Unfortunately the card-size did not match that of the original card set. Although it did not matter too much that they were slightly oversized, in 2007, the set was once again an Essen give-away, now with a matching card size.

Expands:

Master Thieves
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Memory
mechanics: Memory, Open Drafting

name: Steel Arena: Arsenal
description:
Fighting in the arena continues. Day by day, oil flows like water, metal groaning as the sound of gunshots spreads across dozens of kilometers along the empty streets of the city.

The Steel Arena: Arsenal expansion changes the basic rules of the game, offering players four new game modes and providing new attack modules and terrain tiles. Now you can speed up your robots, start the game with extra munition, play with new special abilities that are different for each robot, or add some explosive power to your game using new mine tiles!

You can use all four game variants together or combine them in any way you like.

Pachisi

Four special geek-themed Blend Slates: Twin Perks, Whateley's Strange Brew, Café LaBrea and Lord of the Beans.

Variant Country Tokens: Wild Bean, Fiery Sacrifice, Fhtagn, Dangerous Research and Alternative Crop.

Investment Tokens: Prehistoric Investment, Harmonic Investment and Calculatron.

name: Super Dungeon Explore: Calico Kate
description:
Explosions! Calico Kate bursts into Super Dungeon Explore to the boom of her trademark love of mass destruction. Her pirating skill ensures that she can plunder the best loot from even the stingiest dungeon minions.

Contents:
Calico Kate Hero Model
20mm Base
Game Card

name: RONE: Complete Edition
description:
RONE — Races of New Era — is a strategic post-apocalyptic card game for 2 to 4 players. Players are immersed in a dark world full of destruction and suffering, a world where people are fighting to take back their place after a global nuclear war annihilated all achievements of the human race and all that was left was only a handful of usable resources.

This Complete Edition of RONE includes the Core set with all released expansions in one big box. For back compatibility with the first or second edition, the cards are populated with an expansion symbol to easily distinguish which card belongs to which expansion.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers Deck-Building Game – Éowyn Promos
description:
Set of 2 extra cards for Cryptozoic's The Lord of the Ring: The Two Towers Deck-Building Game, given out by participating board game stores:

- Éowyn: another playable hero, bringing the amount of heroes to select from to total of 8. Card text: "Human Hero / You start the game with 'I Fear Neither Death Nor Pain' in your deck."

- I Fear Neither Death Nor Pain: new card for starter deck for player with Éowyn as hero. Card text: "Name a non-Starter Card type, and then draw the top card of your deck. If the named type, +1 Power."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Munchkin Hidden Treasures
description:
Munchkin Hidden Treasures consists of 78 individual cards for use in a variety of Munchkin games, with all of these cards previously being available solely in annual booster packs sold via Warehouse 23, the Steve Jackson Games online store. Sample cards include:


Can of Worms from Munchkin
Great Caesar's Ghost from Munchkin Bites
Iron Chef R'Lyeh from Munchkin Cthulhu
Mr. Spork from Star Munchkin


A few odd-sized cards from previous Warehouse 23 boosters are not included in Munchkin Hidden Treasures.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Pegasus Spiele, Steve Jackson Games

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Never Night  Asylum Pack
description:
Description from the publisher:

The hunt for Ancient Relics takes the different factions of Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game to the glaciated shores and frozen mountains of Antarctica. Dedicated cartographers, gun-toting thugs, insidious cultists, and terrifying beasts seek to unlock the secrets frozen in time beneath the ice in Never Night, the fourth Asylum Pack in the "Ancient Relics" cycle.

The Silver Twilight undertakes its first expedition to Antarctica, hoping to unlock powers previously undreamt and unknown. Meanwhile, mad sailors, gibbering monsters, corrupted cultists, scarred hit men, and others all struggle to advance their own goals in the desolate climes of a land where all summer the sun glares down and it is "Never Night".

Never Night continues the Ancient Relics cycle's theme of exploring the increasing influence of the Ancient Ones in the world outside New England. Beneath the ice of Antarctica, great powers lie frozen, untouched and waiting for untold ages.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Stardroids
description:
Pixel Tactics is a head-to-head game of tactical combat for two players. Each player has an identical deck of 25 cards, from which they draft a leader. The leader's abilities alter vastly the strategy and playability of every other card in the deck, making the game playable in 25 different ways.

In the game, players take turns placing cards and attacking. Each card can activate in various ways, taking on offensive capabilities in the front rows of the unit, or support powers in the back rows. Cards can also be played as orders – powerful single-time effects that can turn the tide of battle.

Play continues until either player's leader is defeated. A typical game is best of three or five rounds.

Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Stardroids is an add-on pack containing two copies of 11 new characters from the Mega Man series. This is also playable on its own.
categories: Unspecified
mechanics: Force Commitment, Multi-Use Cards, Variable Player Powers

name: Tablin
description:
The first (and only) expansion for VII Legio, with new rules, equipments and aliens.

Expands:

VII Legio
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction, Travel
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: King of New York: Nano Bots
description:
At the start of your turn, if you have fewer than 3 (hearts), heal 2 damage.

Part of the King of Tokyo series.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination
publishers: Egmont Polska, Heidelberger Spieleverlag, IELLO Games, Reflexshop

name: Defenders of the Realm: Hero Expansion #4
description:
Defenders of the Realm: Hero Expansion #4 includes two new heroes – with a miniature and character card for each hero. The new heroes introduced in this expansion are:

• Arcturus the Dragon Hunter: Arcturus gains bonuses to moving towards Dragons (and Dragonkin), for attacking Dragons, and even gets extra Hero Cards when slaying several Dragons at once.

• Tanya Cloudseeker the Dragon Rider: Tanya uses her connection with Dragons to fly with them, prevent their movement, and can also attack them efficiently for a cost.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Pocket Imperium: Prosperity
description:
Pocket Imperium: Prosperity adds yet another layer of strategy to Pocket Imperium's minimalist gameplay. You must now guide your star empire to take advantage of changing new opportunities appearing across the galaxy.

At the beginning of the game, players set the Prosperity cards face-down in a row, which represents the new opportunities and bounty available to those who dare seize them.

Each round of the game, the next round's Prosperity card is revealed, allowing for players to plan to occupy specific systems, raise fleets or take over Tri-Prime, all of which reward the player with additional points.

Each card will also reward players with additional actions, depending on if they played a command card at a certain time in their turn, representing certain actions being more efficient due to market conditions.

Prosperity is meant for those who are looking for more of a "gamer's game" out of Pocket Imperium. It is appropriately sized for a microgame, and offers additional choices at both the tactical (action timing) and strategic (changing goals for bonuses) levels.
categories: Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Red Alert: Space Fleet Warfare – Logistics & Space Platform Escalation Pack
description:
Escalation packs present additional starship models, rules, and terrain to add to the RED ALERT core game.

This escalation Pack contains:

1 space platform
8 transport ships
1 rulebook
2 punchboards of counters

mechanics: Unspecified

name: Magic: The Gathering – Urza's Destiny
description:
The ancient Planeswalker Urza continues to wage war across Dominaria. Will he achieve his ultimate goal, ending the Phyrexian’s reign of terror forever? Urza’s final conflict is here. What will be his—and Dominaria’s—destiny? That’s up to you …

This 143-card set includes randomly inserted foil premium cards. It’s the third and final set in the Urza block, which features new mechanics like Cycling, Echo, Sleeping Enchantments, and Growing Enchantments.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Star Fleet Battles: Commander's SSD Book #2
description:
An expansion for the Star Fleet Battles: Commander's Rulebook.

Contains 48 SSD (Ship System Display) sheets for Star Fleet Battles. 19-Klingon, 15-Hydran, 9-Lyran and 5-Wyn SSD's.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Galaxy of Trian: Wealth of the Ancients
description: In the Wealth of the Ancients expansion, you will get 12 beautifully illustrated, two-sided tiles and 12 large crystals. The rulebook appendix will introduce a number of new rules and mechanisms based on the large crystals.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Leviathans: British Fleet Box
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Leviathans simulates combat between warships that have taken to the air in an alternate history/steampunk 1910. The king leviathans, battleships, are the largest vessels. Maneuvering in support are light cruisers, destroyers and other vessels. Will you captain your ﬂeet for king and country, expanding your nation's power and becoming legend? Or will you fall from the sky, forgotten? You determine the outcome!

Leviathans: British Fleet Box contains the British battleship, light cruiser, and two destroyer high-quality plastic ship miniatures from the Leviathans Core Box Set, but with four new, unique variant Ship Cards. Players can instantly expand their faction fleet after purchasing the Core Box Set for larger games.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Secret Blueprints of Steam Plans 1 & 2
description:
Secretly devise the best plan to create a profitable railroad while your competitors do the same, sharing a common pool of actions and stealing goods directly from other players' maps with this compelling expansion from Ted Alspach.

This full color, professionally designed, printed and packaged Age of Steam expansion contains eight maps (two complete "plans") in the Secret Blueprints of Steam series and as a bonus includes full color replacement mats for Income and Goods Growth. The maps are compatible with both Age of Steam and Steam.

Because of the unique nature of these maps, Secret Blueprints plays in less than 1/2 the normal time it takes to play Age of Steam, as builds and deliveries are all done simultaneously. But there is plenty of interactivity between players, with the traditional auctioning for position to choose actions as well as the new Production action, which allows one player to pull cubes (sight unseen) directly from other players' maps.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Magic: The Gathering – Urza's Legacy
description:
Resistance against the Phyrexians is building. Planeswalker Urza continues his quest across Dominaria, gathering a new flying ship artifact, a silver golem ally, and the truth behind the Thran mana rig. But will it be enough to tip Urza’s legacy to victory?

Urza’s Legacy features 143 cards, including randomly inserted foil premium cards. It’s the second set in Urza block, which features new mechanics like Cycling, Echo, Sleeping Enchantments, and Growing Enchantments.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management

Pink Meeple

Tshevee-check
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Magic: The Gathering – Visions
description:
For almost a year, the beleaguered nations of Jamuraa have fought the evil mage Kaervek. Femeref has fallen, Suq'Ata has closed its borders, and Zhalfir is overrun by refugees. But Kaervek's ally, Jolrael, has turned on him, and with her guidance and visions, there may be hope.

This 167-card set continues the themes of the Mirage set, including phasing and flanking, and features creatures with enters-the battlefield abilities and spells with alternative casting costs.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Hellboy: The Board Game – Holiday Hellboy
description:
Holiday Hellboy is a handmade, high quality resin gaming piece based around an iconic piece of festive Hellboy artwork drawn by Mike Mignola.

Holiday Hellboy comes unpainted and requires assembly, but will most definitely make a fantastic festive-themed gift for any Hellboy fan. The set also comes with an exclusive numbered B.P.R.D. Agent card/certificate so you can use the piece in Hellboy: The Board Game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Zargo's Lords 2: The New Zargo's Lords
description: Zargo's Lords 2 is an expansion for Zargo's Lords: Magic Duels for World Power. It adds 2 new people (the Aracnids people and its web-laying giant spiders, retiarii and poisoned arrows-firers, and the Amazons , a people of shapeshifters and light infantry able to cross enemy zones of control unnoticed), more cities for each people, Magic rules and new rules that make the game shorter and more fierce, forcing players to the offensive even at the beginning of the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Pulp Invasion X1
description:
As a Free Captain of the Rim you roam the far reaches of space as a trader and mercenary. Secretly though you are an agent of the Intergalactic Council sent on a clandestine mission to explore planets infiltrated by three alien races known as The Cosmic Hegemony who plan to invade the peaceful worlds of Intergalactic Alliance.

Find all their world shattering Super Weapons, using your Combat Skills, Diplomacy, and Super Science, and stop them before it is too late!

The game uses a bag builder mechanic to add and remove dice from a bag. Cards are played to explore various sectors of space and 6 custom dice are used for combat situations.

Pulp Invasion X1 expands the worlds of Pulp sci-fi space adventure novels with more adventurers to explore the new planets with and new alien allies to confront, plus expands the base game by adding a variant for 2 players.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Hadara: The Plague Doctors
description:
With Hadara: The Plague Doctors, each player gets access to two doctors who bring things both good and bad to your world.

After the "carving of a statue" action in phase A, you can choose to take the doctor of the matching Epoch, I or II, and place it on a color of your choice on your game board, regardless of whether you have cards of that color or not. For the remainder of the game, you cannot add cards of the plague-stricken color to your board. The plague doctor in Epoch I is worth 12 VP, while the one in Epoch II is worth 8 VP on its own or 13 VP if you have both doctors.
categories: City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Doomlings Blackbox Bundle
description:
The Doomling Blackbox Bundle includes:


Copy of the core Doomlings game
Two Mystery Holofoil Dominant Traits
Dinolings Expansion
Mythlings Expansion
Dual-Color Cards
Kickstarter Exclusive Blackbox
1 Motley Dominant card
4 Additional Kickstarter Exclusive cards
categories: Unspecified
mechanics: Unspecified

name: More Wonders... (fan expansion for 7 Wonders)
description:
More Wonders... is a fan expansion for 7 Wonders made by Shima Tetsuo. It contains 7 new Wonders: Atlantis, Sparta, Helvetia, Angkor Wat, Venezia, Persepolis, and Caylus.

Re-implemented by:

Lost Wonders (fan expansion for 7 Wonders)
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Enchanters: Mythic Deck
description:
The Mythic Deck is a promotional and optional deck (made of 24 incredibly powerful Monsters) that represents the end of time that is about to happen. When the world ends the different universes collide and monsters from other realities enter the Enchanters world.

At the beginning of the game, you randomly draw one card per player from the Mythic Deck, you show them to all players (so that they know what is coming), then shuffle them together and put them at the bottom of the Adventure deck. These monsters have very high stats and are very hard to beat but they give high rewards.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: Magic: The Gathering – Weatherlight
description:
Four thousand years after Urza and Mishra reopened the portal to Phyrexia, the evil lord Yawgmoth sits poised to invade his one-time home, Dominaria. The plane's only hope for survival is a collection of powerful artifacts known as the Legacy—and at its center is the Weatherlight sky ship.

Weatherlight contains 167 cards and sets the stage for the Tempest block storyline.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Fog of Love: Promo Card Set
description:
Fog of Love: Promo Card Set is a set of 3 promo cards for Fog of Love:

Work Party is a Serious Scene for Fog of Love. Created as a promotional item and given away at conventions. Included in Kickstarter copies of the game. Dealing with a tough situation at work.

Country Fair is a Sweet Scene for Fog of Love. Created as a promotional item and given away at conventions. Thematically it revolves around what to do at a country fair.

What Should We Go To is a Sweet Scene for Fog of Love. Created as a promotional item and given away at conventions. Thematically it revolves around what to do for a day out.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Posthuman Saga: Resistance Expansion
description:
Posthuman Saga: Resistance Expansion continues the overarching story presented in the Base Game taking you deeper into the Wilds to track down Mutant Slave Trains carrying human captives and following them to a Mutant Stronghold.

Posthuman Saga: Resistance Expansion adds several new mechanics to the Posthuman Saga Base game along with new ways of scoring and winning the game. Resistance also adds a lot of new content, including 2 new Characters, new Followers, new Mission Objectives, new Event cards and the new Veteran Mutant die as well as a new deck of Level 3 Encounters including over 30 stories.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Storytelling, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: PanzerBlitz: Carentan
description:
PanzerBlitz: Carentan is an expansion of PanzerBlitz: Hill of Death – The Battle for Hill 112, Normandy 1944 which provides two new situations simulating the struggle for Carentan, Normandy in 1944 and a bevy of new troops and hardware.

Panzerblitz: Hill of Death is required to play, because PanzerBlitz: Carentan only includes counters for the new units. American troops make their first appearance (with Paratroopers, Mechanized Infantry, Tank Destroyers, and more), as do German Paratroopers and several new AA weapons.

Part of the Panzerblitz 2 series from Multi-Man Publishing

Originally published in Operations Special Magazine #2 (Summer 2009).

Game Scale:
Turn: 15 minutes
Hex: 273 yards / 250 meters
Units: Platoon

Game Inventory (Operations Special Issue #2 edition):
One 18 x 24" full-color mapsheet
One dual-side printed countersheet (176 5/8" counters, only 92 used for PanzerBlitz: Carentan)
One 4-page Carentan Situations folder
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Istanbul: The Dice Game – Die Moschee-Erweiterung
description:
Available at conventions

Postcard-sized expansion with 2 tiles printed on the card that can be used instead of buying a tile from the selection on the table.

- spend 2 brown joker tiles: You get 6 Lira, 1 crystal, and 1 bonus card.

- spend 4 crystals to take 1 ruby from anywhere on the board.

Place 1 of the spent resources on the tile which was used. This tile can't be used again during this game.

Those tiles do not count for having 4/5 bought tiles.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Munchkin Apocalypse: Judge Dredd
description: Munchkin Apocalypse: Judge Dredd is a fifteen-card non-random booster pack expansion for Munchkin Apocalypse and other standalone Munchkin games that includes the title character as well as "a very Munchkin take on playing in Mega-City One", according to the publisher.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module M – Star Fleet Marines
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

This module adds advanced boarding party and ground combat rules to the game. It also adds commando ships and scenarios for all races.

Publisher Blurb:

"Star Fleet Marines", the toughest hombres in outer space. They will fight anywhere, on the decks of your ship, in the jungles of an alien planet, or inside an enemy starbase. Includes rules and scenarios.
This product has been updated to Master Rulebook standards and split into rulebook and SSD book (no longer a single large book).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Just One: Deutscher Spielepreis Classic Goodie Box Promo Cards
description:
Contained in Deutscher Spielepreis Classic Goodie Box

13 new cards themed by boardgames

13 new cards to create a face-down deck in the middle of the table. Return the cards from the base game to the box, as they won't be used during the game.

mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game

name: Glorantha: The Gods War – Elder Races
description:
Glorantha: The Gods War – Elder Races adds 31 figures to Glorantha: The Gods War, along with 12 control cards, 10 gift tiles, a Dragonewt evolution marker, and an Elven (Aldraya) marker.

The 12 elder races included are: Boggles, Dragonewts, Ducks, Dwarfs (The Mostali), Elves (The Aldryami), Giants, Luthans, Maidstone Archers, Scorpion Folk, Slarges (Reptile Folk), The Vadeli, and Waertagi (Dragon Ships).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: 1830: Take A Ride on the Reading
description: 1830: Take A Ride on the Reading by Alan Moon, published originally in The General volume 23, number 6 (and republished in the Train Gamer’s Gazette volume 2, number 4), adds the Reading Railroad to the game along with several tile-changes and related rules changes to 1830: Railways & Robber Barons, an 18xx game.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation

name: 1825 Regional Kit R2: South West England
description:
1825 Regional Kit: R2 - South West England is an expansion for 1825 Unit 1, an 18xx game. It includes:


Game board
1 minor company (4 share certificates, 2 tokens & 1 pawn)
4 yellow tiles: 1 each of 3 & 115; 2 of 58
1 green tile: 10
2 russet tiles: 1 each of 35 & 37
1 brown tile representing Highbridge


1825 Unit 1 is required to play this expansion.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Modular Board, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Wolfenstein: The Old Blood
description:
This isn't the first time that BJ has visited Castle Wolfenstein. In 1946, he and Agent One, Richard Wesley, successfully infiltrated the fortress. The objective was simple; grab some intel and get out. What they discovered within the walls of the Castle were unspeakable horrors.
Start your campaign in Castle Wolfenstein and find a way to escape while Rudi Jäger is on your back! Navigate through the streets of Wulfburg and discover what the Nazis are secretly working on!

Wolfenstein: The Old Blood offers players four new scenarios that make up a closed prequel campaign with five new hero cards (and minis) and the ability to control your own Mech. It includes two new bosses (The Monstrosity and Rudi Jäger) and three new enemy types that come in two different variants each.
categories: Miniatures, Video Game Theme, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Action Timer, Action/Event, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game
publishers: Archon Studio, Bethesda Game Studios, MachineGames

name: Warmaster Ancient Armies
description: This 96-page book expands on Warmaster Ancients, adding rules for 20 new armies and rules for campaigns, along with some additional rules and many clarifications to the base rules. Also included are several pages of photos of beautifully painted armies.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Salmon Run: Fishermen Expansion
description:
Salmon Run Fishermen Expansion is retail compilation of 4 Kickstarter expansions for Salmon Run, but in a zipped bag format.
It includes:-

Salmon Run: The Fishermen Board
Salmon Run: The Fork/Cataract Falls
Salmon Run: Grizzly Bear Expansion
Salmon Run: The 5th Player Expansion


[Description from Product Front]

The salmon are back for another run! New dangers await along new stretches of river. Hungry Grizzly Bears await your arrival while the lure of the fishermen may get you hooked!

The Salmon Run Fishermen Expansion contains 4 new river boards (2 double-sided boards); a custom-made die; 3 new Grizzly Bear Cards; and adds all the components needed to support a 5th player!

ADDITIONAL RULES

Fishermen Hex:
The Fishermen hex is a new obstacle on the river. A salmon may move freely onto the Fishermen Hex. Upon entering the hex marked with a "hook", the player must roll the die. On an even roll there is no effect. On an odd numbered roll stand the salmon pawn on its tail to show that it is "hooked". A hooked salmon may not move until it plays two Swim cards to free itself.
No movement results from playing these cards.
Both Swim cards must be played on the same turn.
This counts as 2 card plays for the turn.
A hooked salmon may still play non-swim cards normally.
A hooked salmon is unaffected by the current.
If a current moves a salmon into the fishermen hex, that salmon must roll to see if it is hooked.
Bears may move freely to or from the Fishermen hex and are unaffected by it.

Grizzly Bear:
The Grizzly Bear is considered a Bear card and is used to move the same bear tokens as the original Bear card. The Grizzly Bear does not add fatigue but instead makes players discard two cards from their hand randomly.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Racing
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: The New Dungeon: Miniatures and Game Supplement
description:
An expansion for TSR's The New Dungeon board game. This expansion contains a couple of upgrades to the game. First, there are ten Ral Partha metal miniatures included. Six of these are metal versions of the original plastic characters included with The New Dungeon. The other four are new characters: Halfling, Cleric, Ranger, and Gnome Illusionist. Additionally, the expansion contains two new spell types: Illusionary Warrior and Treasure Telekenesis.

Expands:

The New Dungeon
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Ral Partha Enterprises, Tactical Studies Rules (TSR)

name: Bali: Temple of Shiva
description:
Bali: Temple of Shiva is the first major expansion for Bali and introduces a few new aspects to the game.

There are some new cards for the building of the Temple of Shiva. The temple is a 3D temple with base parts and towers.

During the game the players decide whether to sacrifice and build the towers of the temple or if they want keep building shrines, collecting goods for offering, or try to get the priests under their influence.

Additionally, there will be a wooden "Shiva meeple" which is used as a tie breaker

Finally, extra victory point tokens helps make score-keeping a little easier.

Part of the Bali series.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Stock Holding

name: Draco Magi: Expansion 1
description: An expansion for Robert Burke & Richard Launius' dueling dragon card game, Draco Magi. The expansion adds new dragons, new battlefields, new abilities, as well as drafting and deck construction rules.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting
publishers: Grey Fox Games, Robert Burke Games

name: Space Infantry: New Worlds
description:
Space Infantry: New Worlds includes new missions, new enemies, and special creatures, all in one, neat zip locked package.

Once again gamers can take their squad of Space Infantry into the hives, or experience a pair of new surface missions. Additionally, you’ll battle the deadly Void Spiders or heartless Drones. But you’ll have some brand new equipment to battle them with, including the new Flamer. It’s all here and all ready for your preorder.

New Worlds Includes:

Two new Hive Missions (H007 and H008)
Two new surface Missions: Mission S009 and Mission S010
Two new Enemies: Beastmasters and Cthonians
Two Special Enemies: Void Spiders and Drones
One new Unit: Flamer
One new Campaign Sheet
Special rules for Flame and Poison Damage
New counters: Flame Damage, Spider Eggs, Individual Enemy Counters, and more.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Unstable Unicorns: Rainbow Sprinkles Expansion Pack
description:
Rainbows & Sprinkes...

Never judge an expansion pack by it's name! The Rainbow Sprinkles Expansion Pack for Unstable Unicorns is guaranteed to kill. Use Rainbows, cupcakes and Baby Unicorns to kill your way to victory.

Please note: This edition has no tuck box. This expansion pack is from the initial Kickstarter.

Includes 27 cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Munchkin Dungeon: Legendary Pack
description:
4 Legendary Loot cards for each of the 8 Classes: Warrior, Wizard, Dwarf, Elf, Thief, Ranger, Halfling, and Super Munchkin! (Includes the Halfling and Ranger Heroes from the Side Quest expansion.)
2 Legendary dice
An old gaming legend goes that for every Hero, there is a special set of weapons, made especially for their Class, to empower them and bring their natural abilities to the fullest potential. These weapons were said to be long lost, but what do you know, we found them! Buried under giant piles of snacks and dirty coffee mugs, in the darkest corner of the development room in CMON, we have discovered: Legendary Weapons and Armor!

This pack brings to all Classes 4 equipment cards each, bringing them new special powers, in addition to their already pretty cool unique Hero powers. Each Hero gets the right to claim one of their Legendary items once they achieve certain specific levels.

To complete the Legendary Weapons and Armor pack is the Legendary Dice! The Legendary Dice contain all the Munchkin Dungeon symbols you know and love… sword, shield, the dreadful blank, etc. Except that these dice are bigger. And fancier. AND contain a very special symbol, a (dare we say) Legendary icon. For each Legendary Loot a Hero has, they get the right to roll 1 Legendary die. If they’re lucky and manage to roll a Legendary icon, they will activate a super-SUPER special power on their Loot! It's going to be legendary!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Take That
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Steve Jackson Games

name: Formule Dé Circuit № 3: GRAN PREMO D'ITALIA – Autodromo Nazionale Monza
description:
Third course for Formule Dé by Ludodélire.

35" x 20"; 129 spaces; 6 corners (two "2"); straights 28, 18, 18, 17; "2" corners break up 18-17 and 28-18 straights; lots of unused space on the board (hard to avoid, given the actual shape of the track); compacted straights

PIOGGIA : 1 A 4 VARIABLE : 5 A 9 SOLE : 10 A 20

Re-implemented by:

Formula Dé Circuits 7 & 8: Magny-Cours & Monza
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ogre: Strategic & Tactical Objectives Sponsored Counter Sheet
description:
The officially licensed Tiffin Games' Strategic and Tactical Objectives counter sheet

This adds variety and new depth to OGRE games. It includes a selection of strategic and tactical objective buildings, including castle, a seabase, a missile silo, a satellite array, a rail exchange, dome facilities, a Military HQ, a port to name a few, with "damaged/destroyed" versions on the reverse side.

It also contains six "Archangel" class GEV-Mobile Command Posts, in Combine, Paneuro, Black Rose and Ogre: Nightfall rogue AI faction colors, together with biohazard/radioactive status counters, and more.

This product is one sheet of 32 double sided counters
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Evolution: Cybernetic Limbs
description:
Originally offered through Dice Tower's Season 13 Indiegogo campaign (Promo Pack E) as well as at Gen Con 2017

Comes with 7 identical copies of Cybernetics Limb - a new trait card.

Text:
Negates a defensive trait when attacking.
Carnivores receive one fewer food when attacking this species
