mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Among the Stars: Space Farms
description:
'Among the Stars: Space Farms' is a promotional Special Location card set available at the Artipia Games booth at Spiel 2016.

The card set includes two copies of the Space Farms card.

This item card also serves as a cross-promotional items for the company's upcoming title, Fields of Green.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Volcano Tile Promo
description:
This promo originally came in the Polish version of Teotihuacan, and later in the Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstarter.

It is used in Scenario 4 (Volcano Island). As a part of the setup phase place this mini expansion on the volcano tile. During the first 3 rounds you can use explore action on this tile - only 1 action per round allowed. If successful, choose one of the three awards: resolve two Mystery Cards (draw only treasure chests), increase weapon level by 2, draw 2 Starting Items. Then put a black marker on this tile, it's no longer available. At the beginning of round 4 remove this tile from the game.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Novel-based
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Dicetopia: The Steve Experience solo expansion
description:
This is Steve. He is quite the moody guy and you can never be certain of how he will react, what he’ll do or possibly hurt... Honestly, he probably shouldn’t play games at all actually. But here we are, and sometimes we can’t be too picky with our gaming company can we?

Go up against the moody Steve in this thrilling 9 Cards expansion designed for solo play! It can also be included in 2 player games to spice things up!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Starcadia Quest: Build-a-Robot – Extras
description:
This expansion contains 4 robots and 2 monsters.

Robots:

Laser-Tilt
Nano-Dash
Xeno-Shift
Meta-Click


Monsters:

Y-Crush
Omega Launcher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Santa's Renegades
description:
Unwrap special powers this holiday season! Each gift box is a special gift created for Renegade Fans.

Contents:
7 card pack for Lotus
1 promo tile for Lanterns: The Harvest Festival
1 character card for Covert
1 apothecary for Apotheca: The Secret Potion Society
1 board tile for Snow Tails
1 card for World’s Fair 1893
1 choice token for Dicey Goblins
1 card for Clank!
1 Wild Die for FUSE


Lotus: 7 Frosted Lotus Petals - Replace the 7 lotus cards from the wildflower deck with these seven frosted lotus petals. Play as normal!

Lanterns - Snowflake Tile - Remove one other random tile and replace it with this tile. Follow other regular setup rules.

Covert - Kane Character Card - Add to the available character cards. This power can only be used when drawing mission or agency cards from the regular face up options, not when taking cards from the discard.

Apotheca - Tima Apothecary Card - Use the power from the red Apothecary as if it were your own.

Snow Tails - Polar Plunge Track. 2 Sided Track Board - Dangerous Pit: Pick up your speed before the chasm! If you are going less than speed 5 when you cross the line, you will take damage! If you are going to slow, take dent cards equal to 5 minus your speed. If you end your movement in the abyss,, take any necessary dents and then don't refill your hand.
The Narrows: Follow normal rules, but be careful! This side will require some careful maneuvering!

World's Fair 1893: J. Alex Kevern Promo Card - When setting up, replace one copy of George Davis with this card and follow the rules for George Davis.

Dicey Goblins - Naughty Goblin Token - When setting up, replace one of the regular goblin choice tokens with this token.

Clank - Dire Wolf Promo Card - Add this card to the Dungeon Deck when beginning the game. When it is played, count to total number of monsters that are available to fight. Add this number of Clank! and Swords to your pool for this turn.

FUSE Wild Die - Setup: Add the Wild Die to the bag with the other dice. Gameplay: If the Wild Die is rolled, it is chosen by a player just like any other die. If the # symbol is showing, the die can be placed on any space showing a number. If the color symbol is showing, the die can be placed on any space showing a color. If a space needs both a specific number AND color, the Wild Die cannot be placed there.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Quest: Zeit der Helden – Der dunkle Kult
description:
In the first expansion for Quest: Zeit der Helden, the heroes experience a completely new adventure against a dark cult that holds the land in its grasp.

In Quest: Zeit der Helden - Der dunkle Kult, four new heroes are ready for the adventure, with two of them solving problems in a completely new way – through cunning and negotiation. Together with the new game mechanism "Dialog", Quest: Zeit der Helden now offers a much deeper gaming experience. Even the heroes' antagonist, the Questmaster, has four new archenemies at his disposal – but they all are dwarfed by the gigantic dragon entering the battlefield.

With each adventure, the strength and power of the heroes grow. Players can even use their heroes from Quest: Zeit der Helden - Angriff der Orks and continue their journey. (Quest: Zeit der Helden - Angriff der Orks is required to play Quest: Zeit der Helden - Der dunkle Kult.)

German description on pegasus.de:
Der Kult von Kronmar herrscht seit 1.000 Jahren mit eiserner Faust. Gegründet als Bollwerk gegen die Heerscharen der Hölle, ist der Kult heute ein Sinnbild für Unterdrückung und Sklaverei. Doch noch immer lauern die Dämonen im Dunkel und zerren an ihren stetig schwächer werdenden Fesseln. Zeit, dass mutige Männer und Frauen sich erheben und endlich die Tyrannei beenden.

Abenteuer:
Die tote Stadt, Larissas Schicksal, Freund und Feind, Brennender Fels

Translation:
For a thousand years the Cult of Kronmar ruled with an iron fist. Established as a bastion against the hordes of hell it is now a symbol for oppression and slavery. But the demons still lurk in the darkness and fight against their ever-weakening chains. It is time - time for brave men and women to rise up and end the tyranny.

Contains 4 adventures: The dead city, Larissas destiny, friend and enemy, burning stone
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Arkeis: Thus the Sphinx Cometh
description:
A brand-new scenario (integrated directly in the campaign) in which the Sphinx will make its appearance in a context you've never seen before! Like the other scenarios, it comes with its own crate box, containing no less than 39 expedition cards, 5 new adversary cards for the Sphinx, 6 special door tokens and zone markers!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Modular Board, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Quirks Expansion Set #2
description:
The second expansion to Eon's Quirks game.

Adds 36 new animal trait cards (the Carnivore pack), along with an expanded trait value list.

4 Herbivore animal A cards
8 Carnivore animal A cards
12 Animal B cards
12 Animal C cards

Expands:

Quirks
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Imperius: Empire of the Dawn
description:
The ruling house of the empire is in decline & in their weakness an opportunity presents itself. The throne is within the grasp of any rival faction bold & cunning enough to grab power for themselves.

Imperius, from acclaimed designer Grant Rodiek, puts you in charge of one of the rival factions trying to seize control of the throne of Imperius. Use clever drafting, secret information, special faction abilities, and varied planet effects to give yourself the edge.

Imperius: Empire of the Dawn includes even more content to add to your games of Imperius. Containing 12 new Elders, 14 new Events, 8 New Planets, and even alternate art Nobles for each house, you’ll always have something new to experience.

Key Points
- Expands Imperius with new content.
- Highly tense and rewarding interactive gameplay.
- Packed with new interchangeable content to keep your games fresh and exciting!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Masters of the Night: The Dark City
description:
A limited edition, Kickstarter-exclusive expansion containing new content and premium components. The expansion contains:


An additional playable character, Count Dalv
5 new District tiles
18 new Event cards
5 new Relic cards
12 Agent miniatures
9 Minion miniatures
Deluxe red pearl dice
Red resin blood tokens
Premium vampire sheets and box
Metal sigil, veil marker, and kill count tokens


The Dark City also includes three art prints and a story anthology by Gareth Hanrahan.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Boss Monster Big Box
description:
Boss Monster offers players the chance to become the ultimate villain: the boss of their own sidescroller video game-style dungeon! For anyone who has ever spent hours navigating the pixelated perils of an 8-bit dungeon, Boss Monster is just the ticket! Up to six players lure hapless heroines into the self-made dungeon with the right treasures to devour their souls. But beware: the dungeon must be as deadly as it is alluring, or these puny invaders will survive long enough to reach the boss room and wound the boss monster. The best beast wins!

The Boss Monster Big Box is the ultimate all-in-one package for fans of pixel dungeons and black humor. It includes, in addition to the base game, the expansions Next Level, Rise of the Minibosses, Total Destruction, and Vault of the Rogues. In addition, six dungeon tableaus are included to appropriately set the scene for the map dungeons.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Funemployed: Seasonal Help
description: Funemployed: Seasonal Help, an expansion deck for Funemployed, contains over 100 holiday-themed jobs and qualification cards (e.g., Mall Santa).
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: When Darkness Comes: The Darkness Before the Dawn
description: Things can always get worse...and now they have! This is the third expansion for When Darkness Comes... and wraps up the first campaign. It features additional rules and scenarios, more encounter disks and two additional miniatures.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Tile Placement

name: MIL (1049) Land Pack
description:
Essen 2011 promotional land pack.

Include 3 new lands, rice field, linen field and mill.
Replace the starting food lands with some or all of those.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Ether Ore: An Expansion for Far Space Foundry
description:
The Far Space Federation has discovered an uninhabited system in the Ether region of space. The Federation Engineers have determined that a new foundry will be built near the system's rich asteroid belt. A specific batch of asteroids have been found to have deposits of unusual elements. Can you help the Federation benefit from this serendipitous discovery?

The Ether Ore Expansion adds these new items for even more variability in Far Space Foundry:
(4) Ore Cards
(40) Ore Tokens
(3) Product Cards
(18) Product Tokens
(2) Cloth Bags
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Endure the Stars: Cybernetic Onslaught Expansion
description:
These automatons mean nothing to me. Though we may share some aesthetic similarities, there is no soul in those machines. I understand that I may not be seen as human, but I am still a member of this crew and wish to fight for its survival! The Technician character class has decided to join the fight! With abilities specially designed to counter the Robotic Sentries they are a great addition to the fight for survival!

Pack contents:
Olympian boss deck - 22 cards
3x Dashboards
2x Ability tokens
3x Health tokens
2x Resolve tokens
9x Injury token
9x Radar tokens
10x Artemis miniatures
10x Sip miniatures
1x XL Olympian Sentry miniature
2x Technician miniatures (male and female variants)
2x Colour matched base clips
1x Technician Injury dice
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Norsaga: Into the Myths
description:
Your ancestors were more than mortal: they were travelers of untold lands, legendary figures battling the primeval forces of the world… or even embracing them. So what does that make you?

Norsaga: Into the Myths is an expansion for the puzzle battle card game Norsaga. New types of advanced heroes add unique mechanics and embellishments, while additional basic heroes allow you to increase the player count.

Combine these cards with the hero cards from the base game to maximize the strategic possibilities and player interaction in each game, or tailor the complexity to your liking by picking and choosing which new cards to use.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Alien vs Predator: Alien Facehuggers
description:
From the Publisher:

Facehugger is terrifying parasatoid which only purpose is to implant an embryo in victim's body by attaching itself to its mouth. While its strong tail and bony finger-alike limbs grip your throat, all you want is to grasp for air. And that's your last mistake you will ever make, when creature will get inside your body and turn you into Xenomorph's host.

Absolute classic monster from horror and sci-fi genre - the infamous Facehugger is available now as an add-on to core AVP The Hunt Begins game. Miniatures are Single Piece ones, that means no assembly is required.

Box consists of:
5x resin miniatures
1x card
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Forest Shuffle: Hobby Next Promo Cards
description:
Two promo cards for Forest Shuffle: Moor Birch, and Whinchat/Fire Salamander.

The Moor Birch is similar to the other Birch tree cards: you draw 1 card when you play it, and it scores you 1 point.

The Whinchat makes you draw 1 card when you play it, and it scores you 1 point for each plant in your forest.

The Fire Salamander is a fourth copy of this animal, with new art. You may play a pawed animal as its bonus, and it scores you 5, 15, or 25 points depending on the number of Fire Salamanders in your forest.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Highlander: The Board Game – Princes of the Universe
description:
The Princes of the Universe expansion for Highlander: The Board Game gives you alternate versions of each of the characters in the original game as well as new cards to expand your collection. To add Princes of the Universe into your game simply add the new cards into your collection!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Crazy Pawn Games, Gen-X Games, River Horse (Europe) Ltd

name: Tumble Town: Round Up
description:
Tumble Town: Round Up expands Tumble Town by adding in some new building plans that will benefit your town if you've got the right scenary and a new type of card: Wild Mustangs! Tame a wild mustang and earn the respect of the Townspeople, but it's not going to be a walk in the park to do so.

-description from publisher
categories: American West, City Building, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Munchkin 5, 6 e 7: Tutti i Mostri Fatti a Fette
description:
It is an Italian expansion for Munchkin. It consists of Munchkin 5: De-Ranged, Munchkin 6: Demented Dungeons, Munchkin 7: Cheat With Both Hands, Munchkin Marked for Death, Munchkin Monster Enhacers plus some promos.

From publisher website:

Ammettetelo... Avete sempre desiderato combinare tutti i set di Munchkin per giocarli assieme. Più demenziali e folli le cose diventano, meglio è. Ora potete decisamente imboccare il tunnel della pazzia senza ritorno e giocare a Super Star Munchkin Cthulhu Zombi dei Caraibi FU di Nuovo!

Questa espansione non solo vi darà una vera marea di carte in più, ma è costruita apposta per mescolare tutto. E laddove unSuper Munchkin non bastava, ora avrete un Ultra Munchkin. Se i Mezzosangue erano scarsi, i Terzosangue vi daranno quel che volevate. E se non vi basta essere un Baro!, ora potrete essere Bari con Entrambe le Mani! Una miriade di Potenziamenti per Mostri e Oggetti… e un nuovo tipo di carta, il Potenziamento del Potenziamento! Per la prima volta la nuova Classe: il Ranger! Ora potrete addomesticare i Mostri e usarli come Destrieri! E ora, oltre alle carte Caverna già viste in Munchkin Cthulhu, potrete aggiungere addirittura le nuovissime e gigantesche carte Dungeon con questo set! Più nuove carte Portale!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Skull & Shackles – "Goblin Lockpick" Promo Card
description:
Subscriber promo card.

Goblin Lock Pick
Item (Tool, Alchemical)

Check to Acquire (Dexterity, Disable, Craft 6)

Powers

Reveal this card to add 1 die to your Disable Check. Bury this card to defeat a barrier; you are dealt 2d4 Fire damage.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Pirates
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Victory: The Blocks of War – Logistics Set
description:
The Logistics set adds factories and other logistical issues to Victory.

Land, sea and air units each have their own factories, replacing the generic city production points of the standard game. Airfields can now be built, allowing air units to land even without a city or town. Mulberries are temporary ports that can be built by Marines. A storm affects a cluster of seven hexes and moves randomly each turn, preventing unit movement. All the logistics installations can be attacked and damaged or even destroyed, as can now bridges and canals, and appropriate markers are provided.

Expands:

Victory: World War II
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Secret Unit Deployment

name: Quirks Expansion Set #1
description:
The first expansion to Eon's Quirks game.

Adds 36 new plant and animal trait cards (Plant & Herbivore Pack), along with an expanded trait value list.

24 Plant trait cards (8 each)
4 Herbivore animal A cards
4 Animal B cards
4 Animal C cards

Expands:

Quirks
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Carcassonne: Bonusplättchen Spiel 2014
description:
This single-tile mini-expansion can be added to any Carcassonne game. The design, however, matches that of the New Edition of Carcassonne (2014).
This promo was given out (for free) when making a purchase at the Hans im Glück booth at Spiel 2014, Essen. Part of the Carcassonne series.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement

name: Pioneers: Queenie 2 – The Specialists
description:
The Specialists is a mini-expansion for Pioneers that contains 18 specialist tiles. Before starting the game, you replace a number of pioneer tiles with specialist tiles, then carry out the normal set-up of the tiles on the board.

Specialists work like pioneers but are better: the banker specialist lets you take 3 dollars, the merchant specialist lets you take an action already taken this turn, the sergeant specialist lets you replace a road, the barkeeper specialist lets you replace one of your pioneers, the gold digger specialist lets you discard a gold nugget for dollars, and the farmer specialist lets you place an extra farmer on a stagecoach still containing a farmer.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Worker Placement

name: Asking for Trobils: Trobil Makers
description:
Trobil Makers is an expansion to Asking for Trobils.

The small Sagan Colony, full of the galaxy's most ridiculously intelligent people, has taken it upon themselves to get rid of all the Trobils in Paradise by creating robot Trobil-eaters! Of course, their programming went a little awry (as programming tends to do in these situations) and are now just as much trouble as real Trobils!

As if your job as a Trobil Hunter wasn't difficult enough, now you also have to get rid of these mechanical monstrosities!

Trobil Makers adds a new Location to the board called the Sagan Colony. The expansion also adds new Trobil cards, purple Shard resources, Trobot tokens, and a small board. The eighth Ship that was promised with an extra punchboard in the original game will also be provided.
categories: Science Fiction
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Warhammer: Skirmish
description:
Warhammer Skirmish is not a stand alone game, but does provide some modifications to the basic Warhammer Fantasy Battle system.

The book contains 25 scenarios for playing small scale skirmish battles, with forces from anywhere between 2-30 figures a side.

The scenarios are, as you would expect from a Games Workshop product, lavishly illustrated and interspersed with modeling advice and ways to change the scenarios to suit your own figure collections.

The book itself is 50 full colour pages and was priced at $3.95

From the back of the book:

"Endlessly deep ranks of infantry, massed batteries of ear machines and archers firing volley after volley, swords crashing on shields and armor in and unrelenting sea of battle. Such occurrences are not uncommon in the Warhammer world. However, not all important battles take places between two massive armies clashing over a sweeping battlefield. Some of the most crucial skirmishes are fought on an entirely different scale, one that may never be recorded in history, but are no less meaningful in the grand scheme of things."

For some reason Warhammer Skirmish was never released outside of the USA and Canada.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Feudalia: Palace Intrigues Expansion
description: The Palace Intrigues Expansion is a set of 64 new cards to add more interaction between the players. The expansion includes new characters, such as the Student, the Wise Man or the Minstrel.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Dark Red Flags: A Filthy Expansion to Red Flags
description:
This is an expansion for Red Flags. Dark Red Flags adds 75 really, really nasty Red Flag cards to your game.

Here are some heavily censored examples:
_________s every time they smile
Has ________s instead of eyes
Sweats _________

This deck isn’t for the weak stomached or easily offended. We apologize in advance for the trauma you’re about to put your friends through.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Storytelling

name: Cthulhu Wars: Glow in the Dark Independent Great Old Ones
description:
All Faction Great Old Ones (except Cthulhu) as independent Great Old Ones with their loyalty cards and spellbooks, plus they glow in the dark! – includes Nyarlathotep; Shub-Niggurath; King in Yellow; Hastur; Azathoth; Tsathoggua; Rhan-Tegoth; Ithaqua; Yog-Sothoth; and Ubbo-Sathla!

—description from the publisher

The independednt Great Old One version of Cthulhu was a promo available before the Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Fatal Alliances
description: Wargame simulating the First World War using the maps and simplified concepts from the World War II game World in Flames.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Splendor: Jacques Cartier Promo Noble
description:
Promotional Jacques Cartier noble tile offered exclusively through Tric Trac Shop

Requires 4 White and 4 Green to claim this noble for 3 points.

Works like any other noble and is just mixed into any game of Splendor that includes nobles. Cannot be used with the "Cities of Splendor" module in Cities of Splendor expansion
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Renaissance
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Carcassonne: Bonusplättchen Spiel 2016
description:
This single-tile mini-expansion can be added to any Carcassonne game. The design, however, matches that of the New Edition of Carcassonne (2014).
This promo was given out (for free) when making a purchase at the Hans im Glück booth at Spiel 2016, Essen. Part of the Carcassonne series.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – The Great Fleet
description:
Game description from the publisher:

No House can long maintain a hold upon its lands without a strong fleet to safeguard its shores. The Great Fleet – the second Chapter Pack in the new "A Song of the Sea Cycle" – introduces sixty new cards (three copies each of twenty different cards) to A Game of Thrones: The Card Game that add strength and flavor to each House's naval presence.

Warships, captains, and Ironborn hoist their sails to head for battle. Furthermore, three new plots encourage battles for naval superiority and reveal some of what Martell and Targaryen hope to gain from their schemes.

Additionally, The Great Fleet further establishes the naval enhancement mechanism that allows players tremendous tactical advantages. Eight of the pack's new characters possess the enhancement and can join a challenge as an action – even after the challenge’s attackers and defenders have been declared.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: Beasts of Balance: The Lalnalion
description: Meet Lalnalion, a very special beast whom you might just recognise… Inspired by The Yogscast’s very own Duncan Jones, the Lalnalion Artefact introduces a strange and wonderful new menagerie of over 40 hybrid Yogs-flavoured beasts for you to discover and add to your Bestiary!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Collectible Components, Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Crisis: Inventors
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Inventors are engineers (+1 modifier) that are moonlighting as Battlemekk designers for Axia's underground Diesel Demolition Derby league. They have the ability to command their robotic creations to do their bidding and will not hesitate to do so.

At the beginning of the game, add the Inventor tiles to the bag of Employee tiles.

If you draw an Inventor tile when setting up for a new round, place it along with the other Employee tiles in one of the spaces of the 9. EMPLOYEES location. Immediately place the Robot Employee under the Inventor tile, removing it from the Temp Employee location, which is now unavailable. This still happens even if an event has made the Temp Employee unavailable. If the second Inventor is drawn in the same round, return its tile to the cloth bag and draw another Employee tile.

During the 3. PLANNING phase, a player can reserve an Inventor Employee just like any other, and claim it during the 4. OPERATIONS phase. When claimed, the player also takes the Robot tile and may keep it until the end of the round, as the normal rules allow. This may only happen once per Inventor tile.

When resolving 13. PRODUCTION, an Inventor may be used to fulfill a necessary Engineer position in a Company card.

Just like with other Engineers, an Inventor may also be used as a bonus Engineer Employee, adding +1 to any modifier that a Company card may have.

They were part of the Diesel Demolition Derby Kickstarter campaign as promotional cards (https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/ludicreations/diesel-de...).
categories: Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Political
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Worker Placement

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Sun Elf Troop Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Sun Elf Guard Troop Expansion Pack includes six pre-painted miniatures and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #3.7: Behind Enemy Lines.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Shadow of the Monolith Asylum Pack
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The sixth and final Asylum Pack in the "Ancient Relics" cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game, Shadow of the Monolith continues the cycle's development of the exciting new Relic trait and concludes the cycle's exploration of the Ancient Ones' global reach.

Sixty new cards (three copies each of 20 different cards) take the game's different factions to the South Pacific, where they are greeted by malevolent cultists and their dark spells. Who will prosper when the region's Relics are unearthed? Who will fall mad or die along the way? Shadow of the Monolith removes the final veils of the Ancient Relics cycle of Asylum Packs,
but its secrets aren't for the faint of heart!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Farmageddon: The Frankencrops Expansion Pack
description:
Farmageddon: The Frankencrops includes fifteen new crop cards, each with a different ability while in play, for farmers to fight over, spicing up the Farmageddon base game.

The Frankencrops can be combined with the Livestocked and Loaded if desired.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Humor
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Flames of War: Hell's Highway
description:
Hell's Highway is a supplement for the World War II miniatures game Flames of War. It covers the battles for Eindhoven and Nijmegen during Operation Market Garden, September 1944.

The book contains a brief history of the operation, maps, and army lists for British (Irish and Welsh Guards), American (82nd and 101st Airborne) and German (Fallshirmjaeger and Waffen SS support) forces.

Hell's Highway is softcover book and 80 full-color pages.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust Tactics: Unit Card Upgrade Pack
description:
Description from the publisher:

With the intimidating forces of the rival bloc spread out on the battlefield before you, what kind of army will you build?

Gather your forces with the Dust Tactics: Unit Card Upgrade Pack! The affordable Dust Tactics: Unit Card Upgrade Pack includes unit cards for all the units released before Operation "SeeLöwe" including unit cards for all preview miniatures available from Dust Tactics Game Night kits.

Dust Tactics' previously published unit cards have been reprinted in the Dust Tactics: Unit Card Upgrade Pack and have been updated to the new army point costs featured in the Revised Core Set.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: RWBY: Combat Ready – Sub-Boss Expansion
description: Adds 3 new objectives, and an 18 card deck for each objective.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Tanin the Stranger
description:
First Expansion Tanin der Fremde (the stranger)

The noble samurai awaits even more challenges. Clouds of arrows are raining and darken the skies before a battle. Ninjaclans strike in sudden death operations. The steelfan as a new battletactic merges all of the ancient knowledge of fieldcommanders in one symbol. It will drive your opponents into despair. There are enough components included to add even a sixth player to your gaming group. So bow deep and ready yourself to survive the intrigues in the inner circle of the daymios on their way seeking the ultimate power for their clan.

For the experienced Battlelord are new weapons included. Throwing stars and bows are to be mastered. New rolecards add many new different options to the players. Markers especially in use for the daymio give him the possibility to play specials (hostages, family artefacts, ect.) on certain occasions.

New landtiles with structures allow players to increase the value of their landscapes and to purchase additional abilities. Possible bonuses for provinces can be used to improve their power in defence and put some more reputation to your clan.

To use the expansion you need the components from the corebox and the knowledge of the basicrules. All additions in the expansion are for optional use and should be brought into play step by step into your basic game of bushido. For the experienced gamer the most satisfactory result will be probably a bushidosession with all expansions included.

We have provided an extensive overview on the last pages of these rules, which allow players to see all of the new rules implemented with the corerules.

Please note: the term Samuraihonour was swapped for Warriorhonour! And now have fun to discover Tanin - the Stranger, the first expansion to Bushido.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Role Playing, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleCON: Robert the Saint Promo
description:
Robert fights by accumulating tokens into his token pool over time. Each token gives him a powerful passive ability, and can be spent to grant a stronger single-use ability.

Robert is one of the main characters from Iron Clown Studios's "Sinner and Saint Remix", a gritty Manga-style comic.

This promo is available from Level 99 Games convention booths, Iron Clown Studios Convention Booths, and the Level 99 Games online store.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Oracle of Delphi: The Power of Zeus
description:
Zeus himself offers his assistance: Whenever you visit one of his holy places, you receive a reward.

In this small expansion place the 4 Holy Places approximately equidistantly around the game board. Place the Power Tokens on the Holy Places with the corresponding Greek letter.

Whenever you stop on a space adjacent to a Holy Place, immediately take the Power Token from the Holy Place, without payment and without spending an action, if it is still available.

You may spend Power Tokens during phase 2 of your turn (when performing actions). After using the Power Token, return it to the corresponding Holy Place.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Time of the Daleks – Mickey, Rose, Martha & Donna
description:
"Serious, there is an outrageous amount of running involved." —Donna Noble

Doctor Who: Time of the Daleks is a semi co-operative boardgame where with this expansion you can now add more ways for the Doctor’s companions to help the Doctor. Although you must be wary — the Daleks have their puppets and spies everywhere, so you may not always like the Friend you draw.

This Game Expansion adds 4 new Friend models, and the Friends deck to Doctor Who: Time of the Daleks, along with the new Friends game mechanic.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – The Banners Gather
description:
Game description from the publisher:

"When the day comes that you raise your banners, half of Westeros will be with you," Whitebeard promised. "Your brother Rhaegar is still remembered, with great love."
–George R.R. Martin, A Storm of Swords

After two cycles of Chapter Packs that carried A Game of Thrones players far from the shores of Westeros, The Banners Gather and the "Kingsroad" cycle mark a return to the Seven Kingdoms, its Great Houses, their lords, their banners, and their traditional strengths. This is a return to both the game's classic fantasy themes and to several of its established mechanisms. In this Chapter Pack's sixty new cards (three copies each of twenty individual cards), the Lannisters flaunt their wealth, the Greyjoys seize control of rival locations, and the Targaryens march forward with their attachments and Dragons. Likewise, the Baratheons, Starks, and Martells gain new Strongholds, Tactics, and tricks.

Of course, no House is strong when cut off from its supporters, and The Banners Gather takes a look at the many Bannerman characters who swear their fealty and service to their liege lords. Players will find several new characters with the Bannerman trait, all of whom bring powerful new abilities to their Houses and enable new synergies with the game's older Bannerman cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: Zooloretto: Five Extra Enclosures
description:
A Print, Cut, and Paste expansion that includes Five Extra Enclosures for your Zooloretto game. They include the Kangaroo, Monkey, Panda, Camel, and Leopard.

Each of these is a purchasable enclosure, just like the base enclosures you have on your main board. They cost two coins each, purchasable as a money action, and function as a standard enclosure in all cases, except they can only hold the animal type shown on the enclosure and obviously only have two spots for that type.

Home Page & Newsletter:

www.zooloretto.com


(German, English, Dutch, Hungarian, Spanish, Swedish)
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: 1825 Regional Kit R1: Wales
description:

Game board

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game – Gray Hag Promo
description:
The Gray Hag is a promo card that was being given out at GenCon and PAX Prime 2010. It's also been reported that it was being given away to people who were already a part of the DM Rewards program but that people who now sign up will not get the promo.

---

Gray Hag is a Fey creature. AC of 14 and HP of 4

Tactics:

-If the hag is within one tile of a hero, it attacks each Hero on the closest Hero's tile with a blast of lightning. After the attack, pass this card to the second player on your left.

-Otherwise, the hag moves 1 tile toward the closest Hero. After the move, pass this card to the second player on your left.

Attack is +6, Damage is 2 (Miss: 1 Damage)

Worth 4 Experience
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

description:
Space Race: Cold War is an expansion for the game Space Race: The Board Game.

Components:

7 Mission tiles (Apollo Mission graphics on the back)

name: Axis & Allies Miniatures: North Africa 1940-1943 Map Guide
description:
North Africa 1940-1943 Map Guide Contains:

3 full color, double sided, 21in x 30in hex maps with desert & jungle terrain
2 North Africa 1940-1943 expansion battle scenarios

Battles rage across the sands of North Africa.

Conduct operations in the desert terrain of Tunisia and Egypt with the North Africa 1940-1943 Map Guide. This companion item to the North Africa 1940-1943 expansion equips players with battle maps, scenarios, and terrain specific rules to conduct battles fought between the Axis & Allied forces in the North African theater. Additionally, each map offers jungle terrain on its opposite side for use in Pacific theater battle scenarios.

Battle scenarios challenge players on either side of the battlefield, putting tactical skills and strategic planning to the test. Large double-sided battle maps feature detailed artwork and allow players to make use of maneuverability and tactical placement of their units.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Munchkin 5+6
description: Munchkin 5+6 contains the contents of Munchkin 5: De-Ranged and Munchkin 6: Demented Dungeons. Since the second edition it contains also Munchkin 6.5: Terrible Tombs and the third edition uses the combined version Munchkin 6: Double Dungeons.

description: A promo pack for G.I. Joe Deck-Building Game containing a new player leader (Dawn Moreno), an alternate art end-of-round tracker, and a buildable punchboard hangar!

name: Groo: The Game
description:
In Groo: The Game, players compete to be the first to build a large town by playing building cards that give them victory points. Of course, this is no picnic, hindered as it is by other players’ rampaging armies and the frequent bumbling visitations of Groo the Wanderer, determined by the roll of a set of dice, which can also grant players resources with which to build and "Groo heads" with which to damage the unfortunates who have Groo in their village. Players can also develop armies to attack other players’ cities.

This edition of Groo: The Game contains both the original base game and the expansion.

Try to build a town…without having it stomped to rubble by Groo the Barbarian!

Fans of Mad Magazine love Sergio Aragonés, and they love his character Groo the Barbarian. Groo is a warrior and wanderer, never in one place for long…because he’s such a klutz the people run him out!

In this fast, fun game, each player tries to build a town and keep it intact against the twin threats of rival armies and Groo’s “helpful” visits. Roll dice to gain resources, and spend them on buildings or troops…but anything you can’t use is passed along to your rivals!

• Cards illustrated by the great Sergio Aragonés himself, featuring Groo and his friends and foes.

• A hit when it was first released, but unavailable for many years. Includes both the original game and the supplement!

• Plays in under an hour—great fun for as few as two, or as many as six players.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Take That

name: Car Wars Supplement, The AADA Vehicle Guide: Volume 2
description:
From back cover -
Over 130 never before published Car Wars vehicle designs - each fully described and illustrated
Over 100 option, and in-depth guidelines for customizing your own Stats for Sedan and Camper body types.
Comprehensive index of all the Car Wars vehicles ever published, from the first ADQ to the AADA Road Atlas and Survival Guide: Volume Four

name: Eclipse: Minions of the Solstice
description:
Holiday Special 2013

When the galaxy grows cold and the stars seem dim, the Elders of the Solstice are rumored to return from the deep void. But there are also those who roam the worlds before them – the Minions of the Solstice. Suddenly omnipresent in the depths of space, the Minions watch over the galaxy and its inhabitants. Only the humblest are deemed worthy of their help...

Eclipse: Minions of the Solstice is a print and play expansion. It adds 4 Ambassadors that can be purchased for Reputation Tiles. Each Ambassador has a different benefit, such as holding Population Cubes or awarding VP.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

An expansion for the original Pocket Box edition of Car Wars. The components included duplicate counter sheets from Car Wars, Sunday Drivers, and Truck Stop. Also included was a "turning key", a play-aid designed to simplify the execution of the various turning maneuvers.

name: Claim: Minotaurs
description:
Alternate faction for Claim or Claim 2.

If you lead with a Minotaur and win the hand, the other player may take the card they played back into their hand.

mechanics: Trick-taking

name: The Towers of Arkhanos: The Dark Tower Expansion
description:
The wicked witch noticed that the power of light was growing at the ruins of Gil-Garoth as the towers started going up, and decided to try and stop the magic schools from harvesting the magic stones.

THE DARK TOWER is a expansion from "The Towers of Arkhanos" which adds 3 new modes of play:

1 The SOLO MODE, in which you try and build the towers before the witch builds hers and sends her goblins to get in your way;

2 The Witch's game, a new set of rules to play a game of "Towers of Arkhanos" in a totally different and fun way;

3 And the grand master special ability cards.

The Towers of Arkhanos is a fast dice drafting, tower building family game of pure magic and fun.

—description from the back of the box
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Ave Roma: IMPERATOR expansion
description: The Imperator module provides a new action location to the game. Your aim is to capture one of the 5 regions, thereby gaining a reward at the end of the round.

name: Catan Geographies: Austria
description:
Catan Geographies: Austria, a.k.a. Die Siedler von Catan: Österreich Edition, is the fourth in a series of regional map expansions for the venerable Settlers of Catan line.

The rules of the Austria Edition are closely to those of standard Catan, with a few departures to keep things interesting. Players may build cities only in the round intersections denoting actual cities. Because some of the cities are only one hexside apart, the spacing rule requiring two roads between settlements is not in effect. Roads can be built only on the printed spaces; when a space is printed in red, then this road is equal to a trading-harbor (3:1 trading)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Galactic Strike Force: Guardians of Volneth
description:
This expansion adds a fun new gameplay element to Galactic Strike Force, as well as two new sectors, one new Mission for each Opposition Fleet, fifteen Station Cards (five new cards with three copies of each), and a sheet of “Volnethian Artifact” tokens.

This expansion contains the stretch goals from the Galactic Strike Force Kickstarter, except for the Penny Arcade promo card, which will be shipped only to Kickstarter backers.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Munchkin Coins
description:
OverviewMunchkin coins began with the first Munchkin Silver Piece in 2008, a promotional item that gives varying in-game benefits depending upon what month it is. The publisher has released a different silver piece every year since. Typically the coins can only be obtained as promo items at tournaments, game shows, or conventions. Sometimes they are included with game purchases made directly from the publisher.

In December 2009, a limited number of Munchkin Christmas Coins were put up for sale. These were a pair of 2010 coins colored red and green. The same was done a year later with 2011 coins. No Christmas coins, however, were released in December 2011. The Christmas coins have additional rules above and beyond the standard monthly rule.

In April 2010, the Munchkin Blue Silver Piece was included in issue #122 of Game Trade Magazine. The blue coin also has an additional rule.

Current and past rules are posted at: http://www.worldofmunchkin.com/coin/



OtherPart of the Munchkin series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

description:

Cards included are:

The Collective (Boss) - After Leveling Up: For the rest of the game, once per turn, you may remove a face-down hero in your scorekeeping area from the game to give a Room +5 until end of turn.

Overworld Gate (Advanced Trap Room) - When you build this room, if it is leftmost Room of your dungeon, you may choose one Epic Hero in town and place it at the entrance to your dungeon.

name: DreadBall: Midgard Delvers
description:
DreadBall: The Futuristic Sports Game is the hyper-kinetic sci-fi sports game of unparalleled speed and ferocity – a fast, fun and tactical miniature sports board game written by Jake Thornton and created by Mantic Games.

Two coaches compete for victory with teams of beautiful miniatures on a stunning sci-fi pitch. The game is easy to learn, yet challenging, with carefully orchestrated plays and counter attacks hinging on positioning and the mercy of the dice gods.

This expansion adds an additional team made up of Forge Father Miniatures, the Midgard Delvers.

name: Welcome to Dino World: Public Objective Cards
description:
A pack of 5 public objective cards that were free to Kickstater backers, but will be available for non-backers.

These cards, unlike the visitor cards, asks players to draw a number of dinosaurs in specific shapes (including OR excluding generators). Players who achieve them first score 12 points while other players who achieve them later score 7 points. These are publically accessible cards, meaning that all players are tasked with trying to achieve them for extra points. This means that players who have visitor cards which are predominantly carnivore or herbivore heavy, will not be penalised so is in effect balanced, and essentially asking players to play with spatial elements more carefully.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Fire and Ice
description:
"In ancient books of Asshai it is written that there will come a day after a long summer when the stars bleed and the cold breath of darkness falls heavy on the world. In this dread hour a warrior shall draw from the fire a burning sword."
–Melisandre, A Clash of Kings

The second Chapter Pack in the "Kingsroad" cycle, Fire and Ice returns players to the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros, their conflicts, and their intrigues. It also marks a return to some of the prominent themes and mechanisms that have already been developed in A Game of Thrones: The Card Game.

Seasons in Westeros can last for years, Thus, it's only natural that they can drastically reshape the lives of those they impact, and the sixty new cards in Fire and Ice (three copies each of twenty different cards) draw new focus to the game's Summer and Winter mechanisms. They also add a number of intriguing new twists. Not only will you find new characters and locations to grant your deck and House a powerful boost in one season or the other, you'll find two new Seasons agendas that will lead to all-new deck types. These agendas reward decks that combine many season-based effects, and they gain support from other cards in Fire and Ice that help players pull those season-based effects to the forefront, ensuring that the clash between Summer and Winter remains as vital within the game as it is within the Seven Kingdoms.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

description:

—description from the publisher

name: Magna Roma: Dominus
description:
In Dominus, players will be fighting for control of the Europe and North African territories. To do this, players will be able to either use the military symbols combination or the prestige symbol combination.

Players will do this until the end of the game, and the player with the majority of armies in a territory, will win the first place in that territory and score most for whatever the condition is in that territory. We should also note that this board replaces the military board in the base game.

In Portus, your neighborhoods will be able to craft goods which you can then export from your port!

Once you think you have enough goods for export, you can simply turn over those goods to the supply and score prestige depending on what types of goods you have exported! Sometimes, some goods will cost you population, so you need to plan carefully for such occasion.
categories: City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Connections, End Game Bonuses, Tile Placement

name: L'osti d'jeu: Rural
description:
L’osti d’jeu: Rural is the first extension of the popular matching game of crazy ideas! It includes 78 new cards that explore the dark side of the Quebec countryside and all its stereotypes. Use cards such as : "What gives the priest an erection ?" "The Pig Festival of St.-Perpetue" or "Fardoche" to make your games even more wacky!

Description in French:
L’osti d’jeu – Rural est la première extension du populaire jeu d’association d’idées complètement fou! Elle comprend 78 nouvelles cartes qui explorent le côté sombre de la campagne québécoise et tous ses stéréotypes. Utilisez des cartes telles que : « Qu’est-ce qui fait bander le curé? », « Le Festival du Cochon de Ste-Perpétue » ou « Fardoche » pour rendre vos parties encore plus loufoques!

description: This is a promotional card given away at Cool Mini Or Not's 2016 CMON Expo. This card is a spell that has a chance to freeze zombies in place for a turn.

name: Progress: Personalities
description:
Personalities is a mini-expansion for the base game of
Progress: Evolution of Technology. It consists of 15 cards:

5 Ancient Philosophers
5 Medieval Scientists
5 Renaissance Artists


Each Personality provides a bonus for the controlling player. The Ancient Philosophers also determine the turn order while the Scientist and Artists bring to the game the Heritage mechanism allowing the players to give up their long term bonus for a one-time larger one.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017
description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 is pretty much what the name says it is: A board game advent calendar for 2017 that contains 25 small expansions or accessories for 25 different games from different publishers. The game rules for each item are included, but they will also be posted separately on the publisher's website on each day from December 1st to 24th.

There is also a bonus 25th small expansion behind a secret door.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Metagame: Science Fiction Expansion
description:
The Metagame is a card game where you and your friends share your most profound and hilarious opinions about everything. This expansion lets you ask questions like...

Which reveals the secret meaning of the universe: The X-Files or The Jetsons?

Which is more fiction than science: Cylons or the Tardis?

The Metagame Science Fiction Expansion Pack includes 54 all-new cards that add a cosmic mix of books, films, comics, games and television to your Metagame Deck. Brought to you by the future.

Add an intergalactic dose of science fiction to The Metagame!
The Science Fiction Expansion adds 54 new cards that get you talking.
40 new culture cards: Space Invaders to Starship Troopers, Metropolis to The Matrix Trilogy, Firefly to Frankenstein.
14 far-out opinion cards, such as: "Which is more alien?" and "If you were the last living human being, you would definitely want this."
categories: Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Flying Circus Deluxe: Bombers & Campaigns
description:
Flying Circus: Bombers and Campaigns continues on the first installment, Flying Circus: Aerial Combat in WWI, upon which it builds.

The game system resembles Rise of the Luftwaffe but for WWI.

From the back of the box (slightly edited):

It depicts the excitement and drama of WWI dog fighting. You fly the colorful and agile aircraft of that war as you make history in the world's first military use of aircraft.

This is the deluxe game. You will need the basic game card deck to play this expanded version. Then you will have everything you need to play single aircraft duels and team play with multiple flights in swirling dogfights. This deluxe game adds rules for altitude, pilot abilities--including a deck of 25 pilot cards for historical campaigns--bombers, rear gunners, scouts and other optional rules. This deluxe game also includes cards and rules for playing multi-mission games of famous WWI campaigns such as Cambrai and Meuse-Argonne, along with a "Campaign Analysis" article detailing the development of the aircraft, their tactics and strategy.

Now you can become an ace pilot and build your own flying circus.

Contents:

110 Deluxe deck cards (bombers, scouts, plus more fighters and action cards)
Deluxe Game Rules booklet
6 Campaign cards
Pilot log
36 Pilot and altitude cards
Dice marker

NOTE: Damage markers are not provided with the game.

Complexity: Medium (2 out of 5)
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.





User Summary:This is the expansion of San Guo Sha, aka Killers of the Three Kingdoms. This expansion includes 52 new playing cards which divides into basic cards, equipment cards and tactic cards. All of these cards can be directly inserted into the basic game with or without any other expansions.

name: Speculation Queenie 2: 7th and 8th Players
description:
Speculation Mini Expansion 2: 7th and 8th Players, a mini-expansion for Speculation, can be used individually or in combination with any other expansions for the game. This expansion includes components to allow for up to eight players in the game, namely additional shares, money, and company cards.

In addition, each player now has a minus card in hand along with the company cards. Instead of laying down a company card at the start of the turn, a player can lay down a minus card. Before revealing which companies move during the turn, everyone who played a minus card reveals it, then secretly plays a company card or "Bank Holiday" card; this company moves backward on the movement track instead of forward, or one "Bank Holiday" card played by someone else is ignored.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Stock Holding

description: On any player's turn, reroll the die and keep the second result.

name: Zooloretto: Iberian Lynx
description:
A special expansion tile available at LeiriaCon 2010 exclusive of Spiel Portugal and later re-released at Spiel 2013 in Essen

The first player to fill his 6 spaces enclosure gets the lynx tile and puts it next to his barn. The players keep the Lynx until the end of the game.

At the end of the game, after the last truck is chosen and before the scoring phase, the owner of the Lynx may carry out one extra money action. He still has to pay the cost for this action.

Expands:

Zooloretto


Home Page & Newsletter:

www.zooloretto.com


(German, english, dutch, hungarian, spanish, swedish)
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Zoo-ography: Connections
description:
This expansion allows you to build your own monorail into your zoo as you try to meet new special monorail objectives for added variety and challenge!

The expansion also adds co-operative play for up to 5 players as you all work together to build a 6x6 mega zoo. Meet all of the co-operative objectives and win!

This expansion works seamlessly with either the Retail or Deluxe versions of the game.

The Monorail Expansion adds:
- A new build action
- A new attraction
- New monorail objectives
- New co-op objectives

Includes 4 monorail trains & 14 monorail track pieces
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Fishing Lessons: Family Friends
description:
Leland inspired everyone around him, even friends and neighbors. Though nobody seemed to learn the exact same lessons…

This 3-card expansion mixes up your memories by adding 2 new Lesson cards. These are shuffled in with the deck and then 2 random Lessons are removed, making your day on the lake less predictable. These Lessons also feature an option with a mandatory movement direction, giving you less control over your boat.

It also includes an additional double-sided Family card, adding two new characters with their own goals to complete.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Programmed Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: [redacted]: Mercenaries
description:
Money makes the world go round. It also helps secret agents pay their rent.

In [redacted]: Mercenaries, a whole new level of spycraft is necessary, not for the glory of the revolution or to defend fast food and reality TV, but to end your career with a nice chunk of change. With a variety of conflicting missions, players must use the skills they picked up during the base game of [redacted] to work together (or not) and complete assignments for their shadowy employers.

Changing loyalties, shifting objectives, conflicting assignments. Nothing ever stays the same, and players must balance short-term gain and long-term strategy to win, in this advanced expansion to [redacted].
categories: Bluffing, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Team-Based Game

name: Duel in the Dark: Acoustic Mirror
description:
ACOUSTIC MIRROR: replaces any ground defense object. This mirror has two abilities. 1) no medals may be used to put a flak or searchlight in the same hex as a mirror out of action and; 2) In a target city, the mirror provides advanced warning of incoming bombers and therefore gives Great Britain a -1 VP to the bombing run.

Expands:

Duel in the Dark
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Secret Unit Deployment

name: Gingerbread House: Spiel 2018 Promo Cards
description:
Set of 9 cards that were given for free at Spiel 2018 if you bought the game from Lookout Games.

It contains 6 new characters (Vampire, Gingerbread Man, Woodcutter, Game Illustrator, Game Designer & Sea Troll) and 3 new bonus cards (Enchanted Mirror, Raven & Pentacle).

You just shuffle the new cards with the corresponding base game cards.

name: Kaosball: Team – Asgard Valkyries
description:
“We are the fury of Vanir’s own thunder.”

-Nena, coach

Woe to the impious; The Valkyries are here, descended directly from the halls of Asgard to dominate the Kaosball field! Well rounded play skills, they supplement their solid tactics with the occasional deadly lightning bolt that can hit multiple players!

name: Die Siedler von Catan: Die große Karawane
description:
Nomads established themselves in the oasis. The nomads desperately need wool and grain and offer commodities of the desert in exchange for them. Since the Cataners always have a few sheep and grain sheaves left over, the nomads send caravans out, in order to trade for the desired raw materials.
Through the course of the game, three caravan routes are formed with the caravan arrows. All settlements and cities on the caravan route count for one more victory point. Any road running alongside the caravan's route counts double for the trade route.

Published as a free give-away by Kosmos in 2006.

Belongs to the Catan Series.
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Trading, Voting

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Seriously Strong Spirits
description:
Kickstarter/Convention Promo for Red Dragon Inn.

Seriously Strong Spirits is a drink that allows a player crazy enough to drink it to draw two cards from their character deck, and then discard three cards from their hand.

A Spanish variant was included in the The Red Dragon Inn 6: Villains Collectors Edition and the Eco-Collectors Edition.

name: Forces of Warmachine: Pirates of the Broken Coast
description: Forces of WARMACHINE: Pirates of the Broken Coast™ is scheduled to release in early December and comprises 72 pages of new fiction, new model stats, and several outstanding full-color art pieces by artist Andrea Uderzo. In addition to compiling the previously released Mercenary Privateer models, this book introduces new mercenary warcasters, warjacks, units, and solos for expanding armies of every faction and rules for building pirate-themed armies. Models featured in this book release in December, January, and February. More details and previews of will appear in No Quarter issue 15, releasing this November.

mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Village Port: Schatzkiste
description:
This is a new treasure chest that is added to the chests of the Village Port expansion.

It is part of a die-cut sheet, 20 Jahre Darmstadt Spielt. To mark his 20th anniversary the play group "Spielekreis Darmstadt" published a die-cut sheet with mini expansions to five popular games:

• Carcassonne
• Hugo, das Schlossgespenst (aka: Midnight Party)
• Die Siedler von Catan (aka: The Settlers of Catan)
• Village Port
• Zooloretto

The die-cut sheet was sold during the event "Darmstadt plays" from Nov. 15 through 16, 2014 and before that at the fair "Spiel" in Essen from Oct. 16 through 19, 2014 at the magazine "Spielerei".

mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Worker Placement

name: Jurassic Parts: Stegosaurus & Spinosaurus Promo Tiles
description:
Promo dinosaurs originally released during the Kickstarter campaign.

The punchboards contain 3 Stegosaurus (3 tiles each) worth 7 points per set and 2 Spinosaurus (4 tiles each) worth 10 points per set. These dinosaurs can be swapped out for the Triceratops and T-Rex to be used as alternate art dinosaurs OR you can add them to the base game for an even bigger slab of dinosaurs to go digging after!

These function exactly like other dinosaurs in the game and award set points and give you an amber when completed and revealed.

Also includes 5 cards that are player aids. Card backs say "Field Guide - Appendix A" the card faces give the scoring examples for this promo set.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Set Collection

name: The Metagame: Film 101 Expansion
description:
The Metagame is a card game where you and your friends share your most profound and hilarious opinions about everything. This expansion lets you ask questions like...

Which is more likely to incite a revolution: Thelma & Louise or The Sound of Music?

Which is responsible for the most childhood nightmares: Fantasia or Jaws?

The Metagame Film 101 Expansion Pack includes 54 all new cards that add a glamorous mix of box office blockbusters, cult classics, animated features, and silver screen treasures to your Metagame deck. Popcorn not included.

Add a dose of cinematic magic to The Metagame!
The Film 101 Expansion adds 54 cards that get you talking.
40 new culture cards: The Godfather to Grease, The Shining to The Seven Samurai, Nosferatu to Napoleon Dynamite.
14 cinematic opinion cards such as: "Which is most glamorous?" and "Best enjoyed in the dark."
categories: Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Little Duckling (fan expansion for Space Alert)
description:
While Space Alert offers a fabulous 4-5 player experience, the box advertises 1-5 players. Like many players, I felt the 1-3 player experience felt like tacked on, where each player just plays the role of 2 or more people.

To rectify this situation, I made a new board designed for a 1-3 player experience (similar to the idea of using a different board for smaller games in Small World). I dubbed the ship Little Duckling. Simply print and mount the board (on the back of the Sitting Duck if you really like it).

The rules (with examples and clear diagrams) and a complete set of missions (from tutorials through simulations to missions) are included in the Little Duckling handbook.

This has been play tested and I hope produces a balanced and fun 1-3 player experience for you as well.

Released in the File Section of Space Alert, this expansion has had its graphics updated by paulmond.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Real-time, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

description:

Combined with the white action dice, the Swag cards introduce a simplified re-roll and resource mechanic. The Revelation Encounter card utilises purple dice.

(White and purple dice are sold separately and available in Ancient Terrible Things: Skullpips accessory pack and in the game Konja).

name: World at War: Gamer's Guide
description:
From the publisher:

You asked for it (didn't you?), and now it's here (well, almost). Packing with forty professionally printed, and glaringly-glossy pages (including cover) and filled with World at War wisdom, the World at War: Gamer's Guide is on pre-order. You'll find a preview of the upcoming World at War boxed game, World at War: Blood and Bridges. Two new scenarios, Clearing Hell's Highway, and Poor Bloody Infantry. Two battle reports with semi-fictionalized accounts recounts of WaW scenarios (Some of you call these after action reports). A ten page article examining strategy in the World at War series and the specific tactics needed to win all six Eisenbach Gap scenarios. Even variants for night fighting, and a design your own scenarios "how to" article. And much more... including a unit-by-unit analysis of the platoons of Eisenbach Gap...

World at War has been a pleasant, if mild, surprise for Lock ‘n Load Publishing. I designed the game because I wanted to play it. Yes, in the back of my mind, I felt that there might be a market for something depicting the war that never happened, but primarily I created the game because it interests me.

In ten years of writing and designing, that’s the only thing I’ve found that works. I’ve designed and written on spec, and gave those pieces my best shot, but it seems that the games, the writing, that gets my juices flowing are the things other people also enjoy.

I absolutely love playing World at War. I like the combat system, am intrigued by the era, and fascinated by the idea of a series of games that link together to tell a story. So, I’m happy that other people enjoy it too.

I also hope that this guide enhances your enjoyment. We have strived to make a guide that is visually appealing, interesting, and diversified. Inside you’ll find articles on strategy, the percentages of rolling dice in World at War, battle reports (or after action reports as some of you prefer), and unit analysis. What you won’t find are dry as dust articles on the actual forces that lined the West German border or mind-numbing diatribes on Soviet Doctrine. Why? Because that stuff just doesn’t interest me.

There are lots of tables comparing the strength and weakness of an M1 Abrams platoon and a T-72 platoon in the World at War system. And we go through the platoons of Eisenbach Gap, unit-by-unit, and even provide a walk through for winning Blind Sided (a Death of the 1st Panzer scenario.)

All this in a beautifully laid out, two-color 40-page glossy magazine. Yeah, this one's printed. You can hold it in your hands.

Not a stand-alone game.

Expands:


World at War: Eisenbach Gap
World at War: Death of the 1st Panzer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – A Strange Spot and Belt of Gender Swap Promos

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Skirmish
description:
Lying forgotten in the Desert of Bones, the ruins of the spectacular ancient city Shadespire are brimming with untold riches and power, ripe for the taking. Though it is now a mere skeleton after being put to the torch by Nagash, the city's treasures remain, a morbid hint at the splendour that existed before Shadespire’s soul was torn away…

Take command of a small warband of warriors and put your skill, wit and determination to the test with Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Skirmish: a book containing the information and rules needed to fight Skirmish battles – including a hard-fought campaign amidst the ruins of Shadespire! Assemble a small warband of single models and take to the gaming table, building renown and adding to your warband with every glorious victory.

Within this 40-page softback book, you’ll find:

Skirmish Rules

- A set of simple modifications for the core rules of Warhammer Age of Sigmar that introduce skirmish battles – small-scale, intense fights between anything from a trio of models to a marauding band of fifteen models and upwards;
- Details of battling in skirmish formation – models fight as individuals, rather than groups, meaning each model is treated as a single unit. This alters the way certain effects and abilities work in a subtle way, and emphasises fast, aggressive, tactical gameplay;
- The General: each player chooses a general from the Heroes in their warband, who can use a command ability, artefact of power, and three new wizard spells from the tables supplied in the Skirmish rules;
- Battleshock: again, tweaked from the core Warhammer Age of Sigmar rules to encourage fast, brutal gaming, Battleshock can turn the tide of war in a single dice roll – you better hope your general is stoic in the face of slaughter!
- All-new command abilities, artefacts of power and mysterious terrain rules;
- Clarification regarding summoning and generation of extra attacks and hit rolls in Skirmish games.

The Shadespire Campaign

Included in the book is a linear narrative campaign, pitting two - or with some judicious tweaking, more – players against each other in a series of brutal skirmishes as your warbands fight bitterly over the incredible treasures of Shadespire. This campaign comprises six Battleplans representing a story from the murky dawn of your warbands’ first day on the outskirts of Shadespire, through to the climactic battle that decides the outcome of the whole campaign.

Between games, your warbands can earn and spend renown – the more renown earned, the more glory-seekers will join your general on his quest for treasure – and discover Rewards of Battle: charms, glyphs and relics that enhance the abilities of your warband in new and interesting ways.

Skirmish Matched Play

The true test of a general’s mettle is the meeting of equally-matched warbands, where tactics and strategy outweigh sheer numbers when deciding how the battle ends. This book contains a guide to putting together your own Matched Play Skirmish battles, with included points values allowing you to assemble matched warbands from models representing each of the four Grand Alliances. Any Battleplan from the General’s Handbook can be used in a Skirmish Matched Play game.

Please note, you’ll need a copy of the Warhammer Age of Sigmar core rules (available as a free download) to use this book.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

description:
This is an anthology of mini-games of many different types. Edited from the product description:

Chief Herman's Next Big Thing is the sequel to Chief Herman's Holiday Fun Pack, which was released in 2000 and was nominated for an Origins Award for Best Abstract Board Game. Chief Herman's Next Big Thing contains more than 20 original games, some of which were previously published as magazine inserts, free games, or postcard games.

Games in Chief Herman's Next Big Thing include: Fight the Power, Ten-Die Poker, Break the Bank, Monster Builder, Penniless and Insane, Seven-Handed Poker, Darwinian Poker, Caribbean Star, Short Bus to Paradise, Headless in Seattle, Shipwreck!, Particle Stream, King of the Beach, Putwoody's Castle, Herman's Castle, Nickie's Castle, Dungeon Crawl, Hotel Transylvania, Queensland, Graveyard Shift, Board Game Project #55, Land Grab, Magic Hate Ball, Wild Bill, and One Ball (Hate Ball Solitaire). The package also includes two unplayable games: James Ernest's Pontifuse (originally published in Undefeated) and Chief Herman's The Establishment of the Industrial Proletariat, plus the usual hilarious introductions from Chief Herman himself.



Awards
2003 Origins Award Nominee: Best Abstract Board Game

name: Kosmogonia 2086: Oracle of the Dead
description:
Oracle of the Dead is an expansion of Kosmogonia 2086 - Kronos Epilogue for 3-5 players.
This expansion introduces as a new player the King of the Underworld, who claims victory asymmetrically from his opponents. Hades tries to outpower Kronos and take his place as the game's ultimate villain in the final showdown.

Also added to the game is Acheron, a new area with powerful treasures, a horde of undead spearmen, as well as many necromantic spells that contain the hidden knowledge of the oracle of the Dead.
Choose when to unleash the power of Persephone, summon the mighty Cerberus, and recruit the souls of your defeated opponents. Take the power of the grim lord into your hands and rule from the depths of the earth to the top of Olympus!
